title: Autistic Burnout vs. Depression
description:
Many autistic individuals have been treated for depression when really what they were experiencing was an autistic burnout. This video explores the similarities and differences between the two, and how this knowledge can improve your quality of life as someone on the autism spectrum.

TW: Brief mention of suicide around the 10:00 mark

DISCLAIMER: Taylor Heaton is not a licensed medical provider and nothing in this video constitutes medical advice. Please seek qualified medical care before making any changes to your healthcare routine.

👉💤 🥱 Manta Weighted Sleep Mask (affiliate link): http://bit.ly/3n3l64I (use code: MOMONTHESPECTRUM for 10% off at checkout)

🌟 💻 FEATURED INFOGRAPHIC: https://www.momonthespectrum.life/depression-vs-autistic-burnout

🥳🌟 RESOURCES 🌟💌

localizations.en.title: Autistic Burnout vs. Depression
localizations.en.description:
Many autistic individuals have been treated for depression when really what they were experiencing was an autistic burnout. This video explores the similarities and differences between the two, and how this knowledge can improve your quality of life as someone on the autism spectrum.

TW: Brief mention of suicide around the 10:00 mark

DISCLAIMER: Taylor Heaton is not a licensed medical provider and nothing in this video constitutes medical advice. Please seek qualified medical care before making any changes to your healthcare routine.

👉💤 🥱 Manta Weighted Sleep Mask (affiliate link): http://bit.ly/3n3l64I (use code: MOMONTHESPECTRUM for 10% off at checkout)

title: Dear Undiagnosed Autistic Teenagers: 11 Things I Wish I Had Known
description:
This video is a bit of a love letter to my undiagnosed autistic teen self. I’m sharing 11 things I wish I would’ve known when I was younger that would’ve helped me embrace my differences and show up more fully in the world around me. 

I’m Taylor, a late diagnosed autistic mom of 2. Welcome to my channel! Here I share resources that help support the adult autistic community and our loved ones. Subscribe to the channel and connect to a beautiful community here, and if this video is helpful to you, please give it a thumbs up!

title: Neurodiversity in the Workplace: Myths, Advantages, and Simple Accommodations
description:
Neurodivergent individuals face unique challenges when it comes to navigating the workplace. This video is a recording of a live presentation given at RS in Fort Worth, TX over Neurodiversity in the Workplace. The presentation covers:

Taylor's background and late diagnosis story
What is neurodiversity?
Medical vs. social model of disability
Ableism
Common neurodivergent traits
How neurodiversity may present in the workplace
Neurodivergent strengths
Workplace accommodations

🌟 ⏩ Connect with others like you in an Autistic Community Group: https://taylorheaton.as.me/schedule.php

title: Neurodiversity in the Workplace (link to presentation in bio) #latediagnosedautistic
description:
In lieu of a video this week, I'll be speaking at a neurodiversity conference for a company called RS. They are making the livestream available worldwide, and you are invited to join! 

Topics I'll be covering:

My story as a late diagnosed autistic mom
Different ways neurodiversity presents
Medical vs. Social model of disability
Ableism
Neurodivergent traits
Neurodivergent workplace accommodations

When: Wednesday, May 10 at 10AM CDT
Where: https://www.linkedin.com/events/neurodiversityintheworkplacewit7056659158485385216

I hope to "see" you there!

Taylor

title: Sensitive vs. Responsive: Making Peace with our Autistic Nervous System
description:
Autistic people are often told they're "too sensitive." Replacing the word "sensitive" with the word "responsive" can be an empowering change for people on the autism spectrum. This video explores the important connection we have to our nervous system.

title: Disabled by Differences or Environment? A Look at Social Vs. Medical Disability Models

title: Autism and the Brain/Body Disconnection
description:
One common pattern I see both as an autistic adult and in my work with autistic adults is the brain/body disconnection. Today we are exploring this topic as well as terms like: interoception, alexithymia, dyspraxia and apraxia. How does it all relate to life on the autism spectrum? And is it possible to mend the connection?

🤯 ⛑ ❤️‍🩹 Meltdown Survival Guide: https://www.momonthespectrum.life/meltdownsurvivalguide

🌟 ⏩ Connect with others like you in an Autistic Community Group: https://taylorheaton.as.me/schedule.php

👉 ✴️ 1-on-1 Session with Taylor: https://taylorheaton.as.me/?appointmentType=42852597

Autistic Meltdowns Webinar: https://calendly.com/momonthespectrum/autistic-meltdown-webinar?back=1&month=2023-03

❤️ 🧡 💛 MY FAVORITE THINGS 💚 💙 💜

ONO Fidget Roller (affiliate link): http://bit.ly/3xLZnQY (use code: MOMONTHESPECTRUM for 10% off at checkout)

Flare Earbuds for Sensory Overwhelm (affiliate link): https://www.flareaudio.com/momonthespectrum

Manta Weighted Sleep Mask (affiliate link): http://bit.ly/3n3l64I (use code: MOMONTHESPECTRUM for 10% off at checkout)

🙀🌟 RESOURCES 🌟🕺

💻 ONLINE COURSE How to Unmask: Cultivating Your True Autistic Self: https://taylorheaton.podia.com/how-to-unmask-finding-your-true-self-as-an-autistic-adult

title: Autism and Eating Disorders: The Surprising Connection
description:
Trigger warning: Eating disorders. Please watch at your own discretion. Taylor Heaton is not a licensed medical professional nor therapist.

This video explores the strong connection between autism and eating disorders. Why are the two connected and what does it look like in real life? What support is available?

If you struggle with an eating disorder, please seek support. You are not alone, and you are not broken. There is hope for a better path forward. 

❤️‍🩹 Neurodivergent Therapists: https://www.ndtherapists.com

❤️‍🩹 Eating Disorder Helpline: https://www.nationaleatingdisorders.org/help-support/contact-helpline

👇 Scroll down for timestamps and more resources.

🔥🧨🤯 MELTDOWN SURVIVAL GUIDE: https://www.momonthespectrum.life/meltdownsurvivalguide

 🌟 ⏩ Connect with others like you in an Autistic Community Group: https://taylorheaton.as.me/schedule.php

👉 ✴️ 1-on-1 Session with Taylor: https://taylorheaton.as.me/?appointmentType=42852597

🙀🌟 RESOURCES AND CITATIONS🌟🕺

🗂 FREE Big Autistic Resource Guide (BARG): https://taylorheaton.gumroad.com/l/barg

🖥 Mom on the Spectrum website: https://www.momonthespectrum.life

More Mom on the Spectrum Videos: https://www.youtube.com/momonthespectrum

Autism and Eating Disorders (article): https://embrace-autism.com/autism-and-eating-disorders/ 

What is ARFID? (article) https://www.allianceforeatingdisorders.com/avoidant-restrictive-food-intake-disorder-arfid/?gclid=Cj0KCQiA6fafBhC1ARIsAIJjL8mc63QQQNX1HQg5672a_Km68fncCxl3HRJjLEKIOPF97A73iQxFToIaAu1cEALw_wcB

PEACE - Pathway for Eating Disorders and Autism Developed from Clinical Experience: https://www.peacepathway.org/

Book: Supporting Autistic People with Eating Disorders by Kate Tchanturiahttps://www.amazon.ca/Supporting-Autistic-People-Eating-Disorders/dp/1787754456

Book: Autism and Eating Disorders by Fiona Bullivant and Sharleen Woods https://www.amazon.ca/Autism-Eating-Disorders-Teens-Professionals/dp/1787752925

Mapping Emotions On The Body (article): https://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2013/12/30/258313116/mapping-emotions-on-the-body-love-makes-us-warm-all-over 

Instagram account for Autism and Eating Disorder Recovery - Livia Sara @livlabelfree https://www.instagram.com/livlabelfree/

Occupational Therapist Amber Covington, OTR: https://www.synergycounselingassociates.com/team/amber-covington%2C-otr-/x-505

Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/taylor_heaton_
Tiktok: https://www.tiktok.com/@taylor_heaton_

📬 BUSINESS ADDRESS:
Taylor Heaton
8901 Tehama Ridge Parkway, Suite 127
PMB 680
Fort Worth, TX 76177

title: The Importance of Stimming in Late Diagnosed Autistic Adults
description:
The art of stimming is important for autistic people, especially late-diagnosed autistic adults who may have trained themselves out of it. In this video we will cover: what is stimming, why do we stim, why is stimming important, and how do I re-learn the art of stimming. I’ll also share my new FAVORITE stim toy that helps me fidget discreetly during meetings and social gatherings. Scroll down for timestamps to jump to a specific section of the video.

🪀 🙀 STIM TOY: The Ono Roller (affiliate link) http://bit.ly/3xLZnQY USE CODE: MOMONTHESPECTRUM at checkout for 10% off your order

👕 Autistic AF T-shirt: https://momonthespectrum.teemill.com/product/autistic-af/

🌟 ⏩ Connect with others like you in an Autistic Community Group: https://taylorheaton.as.me/schedule.php

👉 ✴️ 1-on-1 Session with Taylor: https://taylorheaton.as.me/?appointmentType=42852597

🙀🌟 RESOURCES 🌟🕺

💻 ONLINE COURSE How to Unmask: Cultivating Your True Autistic Self: https://taylorheaton.podia.com/how-to-unmask-finding-your-true-self-as-an-autistic-adult

📒 Meltdown Survival Guide: https://www.momonthespectrum.life/meltdownsurvivalguide

🗂 FREE Big Autistic Resource Guide (BARG): https://taylorheaton.gumroad.com/l/barg

🖥 Mom on the Spectrum website: https://www.momonthespectrum.life

Autistic Inertia video: https://youtu.be/UmRVTHiJ4-8

More Mom on the Spectrum Videos: https://www.youtube.com/momonthespectrum

Article: Stimming, Therapeutic for Autistic People, Deserves Acceptance: https://www.spectrumnews.org/opinion/viewpoint/stimming-therapeutic-autistic-people-deserves-acceptance/

Article: Flap Like a Butterfly, Stim Like a Bee: https://embrace-autism.com/stim-like-a-bee/

💃⭐️ FIND ME ON SOCIAL MEDIA 🤠🎶
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/taylor_heaton_
Tiktok: https://www.tiktok.com/@taylor_heaton_

TIMESTAMPS
Click on any of the blue timestamps to jump to that section of the video.

What is stimming? (0:59)  
Why do we stim? (1:49)
Why is stimming important? (4:14)  
Did I forget how to stim? (5:55)
Why do we stop stimming? (6:30)
Covert stims (7:01)
What happens when we suppress our stims? (8:32)  
Self awareness leads to change (10:07)
Imposter syndrome when re-learning stims (11:01)
ABA Therapy and “Quiet Hands” (12:45)
My favorite stim toy! (14:06)

title: Why Late Autism Diagnosis Matters: What I Wish My Family and Friends Knew
description:
Late autism diagnoses are becoming more widely shared and many loved ones are left with questions. This video was made in response to a community member who asked for something they could share to better articulate the importance of late diagnosis to their family and friends. 

Topics covered: imposter syndrome, masking, sensory overwhelm, self advocacy, and more. 

Please share this video to help spread acceptance and support for the autistic community.

🌟 ⏩ Connect with others like you in an Autistic Community Group: https://taylorheaton.as.me/schedule.php

🌟 ⏩ Connect with others like you in an Autistic Community Group: https://calendly.com/momonthespectrum

👉 ✴️ 1-on-1 Session with Taylor: https://calendly.com/momonthespectrum/50min

🙀🌟 RESOURCES 🌟🕺

🗂 FREE Big Autistic Resource Guide (BARG): https://taylorheaton.gumroad.com/l/barg

🖥 Mom on the Spectrum website: https://www.momonthespectrum.life

More Mom on the Spectrum Videos: https://www.youtube.com/momonthespectrum

title: Autism and Uneven Productivity Part 2 | How to Adult
description:
Autistic adults face unique challenges like uneven productivity, where we may go into a prolonged period of getting things done followed by a long period of burnout or shutdown.

This video is Part 2 of the series and explores practical tips for managing uneven productivity while juggling adult responsibilities.

👉 Part 1: Autism and Uneven Productivity https://youtu.be/XhwRjSU8PAQ

Scroll down for timestamps to jump to a specific section of the video.

🌟 ⏩ Connect with others like you in an Autistic Community Group: https://taylorheaton.as.me/schedule.php

👉 ✴️ 1-on-1 Session with Taylor: https://taylorheaton.as.me/?appointmentType=42852597

❤️ 🧡 💛 MY FAVORITE THINGS 💚 💙 💜

ONO Fidget Roller (affiliate link): http://bit.ly/3xLZnQY (use code: MOMONTHESPECTRUM for 10% off at checkout)

Flare Earbuds for Sensory Overwhelm (affiliate link): https://www.flareaudio.com/momonthespectrum

Manta Weighted Sleep Mask (affiliate link): http://bit.ly/3n3l64I (use code: MOMONTHESPECTRUM for 10% off at checkout)

🙀🌟 RESOURCES 🌟🕺

💻 ONLINE COURSE How to Unmask: Cultivating Your True Autistic Self: https://taylorheaton.podia.com/how-to-unmask-finding-your-true-self-as-an-autistic-adult

📒 Meltdown Survival Guide: https://www.momonthespectrum.life/meltdownsurvivalguide

🗂 FREE Big Autistic Resource Guide (BARG): https://taylorheaton.gumroad.com/l/barg

🖥 Mom on the Spectrum website: https://www.momonthespectrum.life

More Mom on the Spectrum Videos: https://www.youtube.com/momonthespectrum

📈 Mom on the Spectrum YouTube Community Page with more Uneven Productivity Suggestions: https://www.youtube.com/post/Ugkx4h_gbsYG8ozw57X2BtLKK8aSteSmxE5s

🧑‍🔬 Autistic Inertia video: https://youtu.be/UmRVTHiJ4-8

🥄 Spoon theory video: https://youtu.be/aBzy6cx4R8I

💌 Community Groups: https://www.momonthespectrum.life/community

💃⭐️ FIND ME ON SOCIAL MEDIA 🤠🎶
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/taylor_heaton_
Tiktok: https://www.tiktok.com/@taylor_heaton_

📬 BUSINESS ADDRESS:
Taylor Heaton
8901 Tehama Ridge Parkway, Suite 127
PMB 680
Fort Worth, TX 76177

📧 Business inquiries: info@momonthespectrum.life

🟧 LIKE the videos that are helpful to you
🟨 COMMENT in the comment section
🟩 Click the “bell” to be notified when I release new videos

🙏 Thank you immensely to those of you who have already donated, been active on the channel, and/or purchased the Meltdown Survival Guide.

⏰ Timestamps
Click on any of the blue timestamps below to jump to that particular section of the video.

What is uneven productivity? (1:06)
List of tips begins (2:19)
Communicate about your patterns (2:19)
Ask others to get your attention first before starting a conversation (4:04)
Buffer zone (4:44)
Plan your schedule to suit your needs (6:01)
Spoon theory (7:12) 
Body Doubling (8:11)
Physical stims (8:45)
Timers (10:09)
Transition into a sensory-friendly environment (10:39)
Body check-ins (11:10)
Give yourself grace (13:07)

title: Embodiment and Autistic Trauma
description:
TW: Abuse and Trauma

Trauma work should be done with a licensed medical professional. Taylor Heaton is not a licensed medical professional. Please seek professional support when working through traumatic experiences.

Unfortunately, autistic people are more likely to experience abuse and trauma. Trauma responses (fight/flight/freeze/fawn) have significant impacts on our bodies, and as we learn to integrate those experiences in a safe environment, we gain more control over our lives. This video explores the role of embodiment in healing autistic trauma.

Scroll down for timestamps. ⬇️

localizations.en.title: Embodiment and Autistic Trauma
localizations.en.description:
TW: Abuse and Trauma

Trauma work should be done with a licensed medical professional. Taylor Heaton is not a licensed medical professional. Please seek professional support when working through traumatic experiences.

Unfortunately, autistic people are more likely to experience abuse and trauma. Trauma responses (fight/flight/freeze/fawn) have significant impacts on our bodies, and as we learn to integrate those experiences in a safe environment, we gain more control over our lives. This video explores the role of embodiment in healing autistic trauma.

Scroll down for timestamps. ⬇️

🌟 ⏩ Connect with others like you in an Autistic Community Group: https://taylorheaton.as.me/schedule.php

title: Holidays on the Autism Spectrum: Too Many Expectations?
description:
Holidays can be extra stressful for people on the autism spectrum. Today's livestream will feature a presentation I gave during one of our recent Autistic Community Groups. We will be covering social stress, meltdown management, and boundary setting.

🌟 ⏩ Connect with others like you in an Autistic Community Group: https://taylorheaton.as.me/schedule.php

title: Community Group Winner Reveal
description:
I'm Tay, a married mom of 2 who was diagnosed with Autism at 31 years old. This was after YEARS of therapy (and all of the self tests in the world!). My diagnosis has brought up questions, frustration, doubt, but most importantly, a new level of self compassion and understanding.

I'm here to share knowledge, resources, and products that empower other neurodivergents (and their loved ones) to live freely and creatively. I'm not a doctor so please speak with your healthcare providers before implementing any recommendations I make on my channel.

Females are under-diagnosed due to lack of research. Please share any videos that are helpful to you so we can spread awareness and acceptance.

title: Autistic Mom Takes The AQ (Autism Spectrum Quotient) Assessment | 50 Questions
description:
The Autism Spectrum Quotient (AQ) assessment is a free online tool for assessing whether or not you may be on the autism spectrum.

DISCLAIMER: Scoring high on this test does not necessarily mean you are autistic. The AQ is frequently used in combination with other interventions for assessing autism.Taylor is not a medical professional or therapist. Please consult with your own medical health professionals before implementing any changes in your routine.

title: Magic Earbuds for Sensory Overwhelm, @flare-audio + @MomontheSpectrum #actuallyautistic
description:
🥳 I’ve teamed up with Flare Audio to give away THREE PAIRS of my favorite earbuds for managing sensory overwhelm.

👂I love these earbuds because I forget I’m wearing them. There is a hole at the bottom so sound still comes in and doesn’t get muffled. The design helps filter out upsetting high and low frequencies so you have a smoother overall auditory experience. I am continually amazed at how much of a difference these make in my everyday life.

🎉🪩🥂THERE WILL BE 3 WINNERS and each winner will receive 1 pair of Calmer OR Calmer Secure earbuds for adults. 

🚨 TO ENTER GIVEAWAY:
1️⃣ Follow @taylor_heaton_ on Instagram
2️⃣ Like this post on Instagram
3️⃣ Tag two people who might enjoy these earbuds
🌟 👉 BONUS: Share in your Instagram stories for an extra 5 entries (make sure to tag @taylor_heaton_ )

To snag your own pair of earbuds or explore the collection, go to https://www.flareaudio.com/MomOnTheSpectrum

The giveaway is open to residents in the US and Canada only. Must be 18 or older to win. The giveaway runs until 12:00pm CDT on Friday, September 2. There will be 3 winners and each winner will be chosen randomly and announced on Friday, September 2 at 5:00pm central time in my Instagram stories. 

This promotion is in no way sponsored, administered, or associated with Instagram, Inc or YouTube. By entering, entrants confirm that they are 18+ years of age, release Instagram of responsibility, and agree to Instagram’s terms of use. Taylor Heaton, LLC received merchandise from Flare in exchange for hosting this giveaway. 

👉 ✴️ NEW: 1-on-1 Coaching with Taylor: https://calendly.com/momonthespectrum/50min

👉 ✴️ NEW: Autistic Community Groups: https://calendly.com/momonthespectrum/autistic-community-groups

🌟🌟🌟

title: The Big Autistic Resource Guide: Free Support for Autistic Individuals & Businesses
description:
According to Forbes.com, up to 85% of the autistic community is unemployed.* I know the autistic community to be full of capable, brilliant people who deserve the opportunity to work hard and showcase their skills, so I created the Big Autistic Resource Guide (BARG)  to help us do just that! 

In this video I’ll discuss the contents of the BARG, how to download it, and how to be featured in it for free. 

👉 Please share the BARG with anyone and everyone who may benefit from it. It is designed to thrive from community involvement. The more we share, the more it grows. 🪴

⭐️🌟⭐️ DOWNLOAD THE BARG ⭐️🌟⭐️: https://taylorheaton.gumroad.com/l/barg

🌟 ⏩ Connect with others like you in an Autistic Community Group: https://taylorheaton.as.me/schedule.php

👉 ✴️ 1-on-1 Session with Taylor: https://taylorheaton.as.me/?appointmentType=42852597

localizations.en.description:
According to Forbes.com, up to 85% of the autistic community is unemployed.* I know the autistic community to be full of capable, brilliant people who deserve the opportunity to work hard and showcase their skills, so I created the Big Autistic Resource Guide (BARG)  to help us do just that! 

In this video I’ll discuss the contents of the BARG, how to download it, and how to be featured in it for free. 

👉 Please share the BARG with anyone and everyone who may benefit from it. It is designed to thrive from community involvement. The more we share, the more it grows. 🪴

title: HELLO! And an update, just because
description:
I'm Tay, a married mom of 2 who was diagnosed with Autism at 31 years old. This was after YEARS of therapy (and all of the self tests in the world!). My diagnosis has brought up questions, frustration, doubt, but most importantly, a new level of self compassion and understanding.

I'm here to share knowledge, resources, and products that empower other neurodivergents (and their loved ones) to live freely and creatively. I'm not a doctor so please speak with your healthcare providers before implementing any recommendations I make on my channel.

Females are under-diagnosed due to lack of research. Please share any videos that are helpful to you so we can spread awareness and acceptance.



#autism #autistic #actuallyautistic

title: Staying Sane in Troubled Times: 9 Powerful Strategies
description:
There’s no escaping the truth: times are tough, no matter what part of the world you’re living in. In this video I’m sharing 9 powerful strategies for managing stress and anxiety during difficult times - strategies that might even help you navigate that tricky conversation with Uncle Larry this 4th of July.

POST-VIDEO LIVESTREAM DISCUSSION REPLAY: https://youtu.be/UdO5Zuy1kp8

🌟 ⏩ Connect with others like you in an Autistic Community Group: https://taylorheaton.as.me/schedule.php

👉 ✴️ 1-on-1 Session with Taylor: https://taylorheaton.as.me/?appointmentType=42852597

❤️ 🧡 💛 MY FAVORITE THINGS 💚 💙 💜

ONO Fidget Roller (affiliate link): http://bit.ly/3xLZnQY (use code: MOMONTHESPECTRUM for 10% off at checkout)

Flare Earbuds for Sensory Overwhelm (affiliate link): https://www.flareaudio.com/momonthespectrum

Manta Weighted Sleep Mask (affiliate link): http://bit.ly/3n3l64I (use code: MOMONTHESPECTRUM for 10% off at checkout)

⬇️ Scroll down for timestamps to jump to a specific section + links to resources mentioned in the video  ⬇️

⭐️ FIND ME ON SOCIAL MEDIA 🤠

Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/taylor_heaton_
Tiktok: https://www.tiktok.com/@taylor_heaton_

⏰ Timestamps ⏰ 
Intro and disclaimer (0:48)
Allow yourself to feel the weight of your emotions (1:23)
1b. Don’t air your grievances on social media (3:36)
Take care of yourself (4:02)
You can’t change anyone’s mind (5:17)
Signs that it may be better to leave the conversation (6:52)
Signs of healthy, balanced discussion where change is possible (8:28)
Don’t try to change people’s minds through social media (8:57)
Set boundaries (9:50)
Clearly communicating boundaries (11:09)
Broken record technique (11:52)
Look for the helpers and then become a helper (12:37)
Create (14:58)

Stay in the present moment (18:45)
Closing thoughts (21:19)

title: Childhood Autistic Traits - Post Video Discussion
description:
This video is a replay of a livestream discussion based on the original video, 10 Childhood Autistic Traits that you can watch here: https://youtu.be/S7SJKxMSYI4

As a child, medical professionals said I was stressed, anxious, and shy. It wasn’t until I turned 31 that I was finally able to put all of the pieces together in a way that made sense. I realized with the help of a psychologist that I’m autistic.

I am not a doctor or medical professional. I am a 33-year-old autistic mom and I’m sharing my experiences to spread awareness of how autism presents, to connect others like me to resources and support, and to empower people on the spectrum to live confident, successful lives.

Please consult your healthcare provider before making any changes to your healthcare routine.

Also, please note that relating to some of these traits does not mean you are autistic. It is part of a much larger picture. If you’re interested in learning more about whether or not you might be on the spectrum, you may find the following video suggestion helpful along with my playlist over the diagnostic process:

Am I autistic? What should I do next? https://youtu.be/nQnvLKrFDkU

⬇️ Scroll down for timestamps! ⬇️

🟥🟧🟨  SUPPORT THE CHANNEL 🟩🟦🟪
1️⃣ If you have been positively impacted by the channel and would like to show your support, you can do so in the following ways 🤗

🔵 PayPal: paypal.me/MomOnTheSpectrum
🟢 Venmo: @TaylorHeaton

2️⃣  MELTDOWN SURVIVAL GUIDE ⭐️✨🤩💃💪
Name Your Price for my custom-created 11-page Meltdown Survival Guide to help you make it through the tough times.
👉 https://taylorheaton.gumroad.com/l/meltdownsurvivalguide

3️⃣  MOTS MERCHANDISE 👕🩳👚
Explore a wide selection of comfortable and sustainable clothing that supports your autistic lifestyle. 
https://momonthespectrum.teemill.com/

👏🏻 FREE 👏🏻 WAYS TO SHOW YOUR SUPPORT 🦾
🟥 SUBSCRIBE to the channel
🟧 LIKE the videos that are helpful to you
🟨 COMMENT in the comment section
🟩 Click the “bell” to be notified when I release new videos

🙏 Thank you immensely to those of you who have already donated, been active on the channel, and/or purchased the Meltdown Survival Guide! 
# WhatDreamsAreMadeOf # IsThisMyLife


📚 Resources 💻
10 Childhood Autistic Traits (Original): https://youtu.be/S7SJKxMSYI4

⭐️ MELTDOWN SURVIVAL GUIDE ⭐️: https://taylorheaton.gumroad.com/l/meltdownsurvivalguide

🦻 FLARE Noise Reducing Earbuds (Affiliate link): https://www.flareaudio.com/momonthespectrum

​​🌈 More Mom on the Spectrum Videos: ​​https://www.youtube.com/c/MomontheSpectrum

🖥 Mom on the Spectrum website: https://www.momonthespectrum.net

🎥 16 Overlooked Autistic Traits in Females (video): https://youtu.be/xeZZHnQYoR4

👥 Mom on the Spectrum Community: https://www.youtube.com/c/MomontheSpectrum/community

👚 🩳 👕 MOTS Merchandise: https://momonthespectrum.teemill.com/

Online Autism Assessments: https://www.embrace-autism.com


⭐️ FIND ME ON SOCIAL MEDIA 🤠

Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/taylor_heaton_

Tiktok: https://www.tiktok.com/@taylor_heaton_

🌿🌿🌿🌿🌿

I'm Tay, a married mom of 2 who was diagnosed with Autism at 31 years old. This was after YEARS of therapy (and all of the self tests in the world!). My diagnosis has brought up questions, frustration, doubt, but most importantly, a new level of self compassion and understanding.

I'm here to share knowledge, resources, and products that empower other neurodivergents (and their loved ones) to live freely and creatively. I'm not a doctor so please speak with your healthcare providers before implementing any recommendations I make on my channel.

Women are under-diagnosed due to lack of research. Please share any videos that are helpful to you so we can spread awareness and acceptance.

You are a beautiful person worthy of love!

🌿🌿🌿🌿🌿

I'm Tay, a married mom of 2 who was diagnosed with Autism at 31 years old. This was after YEARS of therapy (and all of the self tests in the world!). My diagnosis has brought up questions, frustration, doubt, but most importantly, a new level of self compassion and understanding.

I'm here to share knowledge, resources, and products that empower other neurodivergents (and their loved ones) to live freely and creatively. I'm not a doctor so please speak with your healthcare providers before implementing any recommendations I make on my channel.

Women are under-diagnosed due to lack of research. Please share any videos that are helpful to you so we can spread awareness and acceptance.

Music by Milky Wayvers ("Mountain")
https://soundcloud.com/freetousemusic/milky-wayvers-mountain

You are a beautiful person worthy of love!

title: Disney DAS Pass | Disability Access Service | Qualifications and Step-by-Step Registration Process
description:
If you are traveling to Disney World as someone with a disability (or different ability) such as autism, you can apply for the Disney Disability Access Service, or DAS Pass, to gain entry to rides and attractions without waiting in general admission lines. Scroll down for timestamps to skip to a specific section of the video.

I scoured the internet for resources to help me during the DAS Pass registration process and compiled everything I learned into this video!

✨ We will cover:

1. What is the DAS Pass and how does it work?
2. Step-by-Step Online Registration/Video Chat Process (including the Advanced Selection text chat process)
3. Tips for getting the most out of the DAS Pass

➡️ ⭐️ From Disney's website https://disneyworld.disney.go.com/guest-services/disability-access-service/ Disability Access Service (DAS) is a program offered at Walt Disney World theme parks to assist Guests who have difficulty tolerating extended waits in a conventional queue environment due to disability.

📪 Business Mailing Address 📬
Taylor Heaton
8901 Tehama Ridge Parkway, Suite 127
PMB 680
Fort Worth, TX 76177

🌟 ⏩ Connect with others like you in an Autistic Community Group: https://taylorheaton.as.me/schedule.php

👉 ✴️ 1-on-1 Session with Taylor: https://taylorheaton.as.me/?appointmentType=42852597

❤️ 🧡 💛 MY FAVORITE THINGS 💚 💙 💜

ONO Fidget Roller (affiliate link): http://bit.ly/3xLZnQY (use code: MOMONTHESPECTRUM for 10% off at checkout)

Flare Earbuds for Sensory Overwhelm (affiliate link): https://www.flareaudio.com/momonthespectrum

Manta Weighted Sleep Mask (affiliate link): http://bit.ly/3n3l64I (use code: MOMONTHESPECTRUM for 10% off at checkout)

✨ TIMESTAMPS ✨

(1:09) What is the DAS Pass?
(2:43) Asking for specific accommodations 
(4:06) The DAS Registration Process - Guidelines
(4:16) Advanced Selections
(5:25) When you can start applying for the DAS Pass
(7:54) What do you need in order to apply?
(8:11) Pre-Registration checklist
(10:00) Step-by-Step Registration Process - Video Call/Interview
(16:40) Scheduling Your Advance Selections - Text Chat
(19:20) Attraction Selection Questions/Guest Relations
(20:08) Tips for Success with Your Party/Group

HELPFUL RESOURCES

⭐️ 🌟 Downloadable Disney Scavenger Hunt for Kids with Special Needs: https://taylorheaton.gumroad.com/l/disney-scavenger-hunt

DAS Pass Registration: https://disneyworld.disney.go.com/guest-services/disability-access-service/register/

# WhatDreamsAreMadeOf # IsThisMyLife


I'm Tay, a married mom of 2 who was diagnosed with Autism at 31 years old. This was after YEARS of therapy (and all of the self tests in the world!). My diagnosis has brought up questions, frustration, doubt, but most importantly, a new level of self compassion and understanding.

I'm here to share knowledge, resources, and products that empower other neurodivergents (and their loved ones) to live freely and creatively. I'm not a doctor so please speak with your healthcare providers before implementing any recommendations I make on my channel.

Women are under-diagnosed due to lack of research. Please share any videos that are helpful to you so we can spread awareness and acceptance.

Music by Milky Wayvers ("Mountain")
https://soundcloud.com/freetousemusic/milky-wayvers-mountain

title: Autism & Friendship 101 | Burnout, Oversharing and more! | Featuring Claire from Woodshed Theory
description:
This video explores the world of friendship through the lens of two autistic adults, featuring Claire Leick from @WoodshedTheory !

We covered so many topics, we had to split the video into two parts, so make sure you subscribe to the channel and click the little bell so you'll be notified when we drop the second episode. (And all of our socials are listed at the bottom! ⬇️  TikTok, anyone?)

Today we're covering communication, missed social cues, delayed processing, and so much more! Be sure to check out the timestamps below to jump to a specific section and learn more about other topics we'll be exploring.

🌟 ⏩ Connect with others like you in an Autistic Community Group: https://taylorheaton.as.me/schedule.php

👉 ✴️ 1-on-1 Session with Taylor: https://taylorheaton.as.me/?appointmentType=42852597

💻 ONLINE COURSE How to Unmask: Cultivating Your True Autistic Self: https://taylorheaton.podia.com/how-to-unmask-finding-your-true-self-as-an-autistic-adult

❤️ 🧡 💛 MY FAVORITE THINGS 💚 💙 💜

ONO Fidget Roller (affiliate link): http://bit.ly/3xLZnQY (use code: MOMONTHESPECTRUM for 10% off at checkout)

Flare Earbuds for Sensory Overwhelm (affiliate link): https://www.flareaudio.com/momonthespectrum

Manta Weighted Sleep Mask (affiliate link): http://bit.ly/3n3l64I (use code: MOMONTHESPECTRUM for 10% off at checkout)

📪 Business Mailing Address 📬
Taylor Heaton
8901 Tehama Ridge Parkway, Suite 127
PMB 680
Fort Worth, TX 76177

⏰ TIMESTAMPS ⏳

(1:16) About Claire
(3:11) What does friendship on the spectrum look like?
(5:57) Meeting neurotypicals at their level
(6:45) The role of laughter in communication
(8:22) How COVID changed things
(9:14) Feeling the “need” for friendship
(10:18) The effects of delayed processing
(11:07) When other people want to join in with what you’re doing
(12:26) Quality over quantity?
(13:20) The cost of friendship/ what we invest
(13:51) Empathy
(14:45) Neurotypical vs. autistic communication
(17:36) Overthinking
(18:55) Feeling like “too much”
(20:51) Getting stuck in our heads vs. listening to our bodies
(21:40) Managing Expectations
(26:09) Talking through what you’re thinking and feeling

💻  RESOURCES 📚

👚 MOTS Merchandise!: https://momonthespectrum.teemill.com/

🦻 Flare Noise Reducing Earbuds (Affiliate Link): https://www.flareaudio.com/momonthespectrum

Downloadable Meltdown Survival Guide: https://taylorheaton.gumroad.com/l/meltdownsurvivalguide

More Mom on the Spectrum Videos: ​​https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC0rQDkXDNeidKnUafldmpdA

Mom on the Spectrum website: https://www.momonthespectrum.life

16 Overlooked Autistic Traits in Females (video): https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xeZZHnQYoR4

Mom on the Spectrum downloadable content: taylorheaton.gumroad.com

The Adult Autism Diagnostic Process (Video Series): https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=J9TTW83NYHI&list=PLPldqebdOdMC6WScHpGEt0c-jfHhSluj-

📲 MY SOCIALS 💌

TikTok: https://www.tiktok.com/@taylor_heaton_
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/taylor_heaton_/
YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/momonthespectrum

📲 CLAIRE FROM WOODSHED THEORY SOCIALS 💌

YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/c/WoodshedTheory
IG: @woodshed_theory
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/WoodshedTheory

🌱🌿🪴🌱🌿🪴🌱🌿🪴🌱🌿🪴🌱🌿🪴

I'm Tay, a married mom of 2 who was diagnosed with Autism at 31 years old. This was after YEARS of therapy (and all of the self tests in the world!). My diagnosis has brought up questions, frustration, doubt, but most importantly, a new level of self compassion and understanding.

I'm here to share knowledge, resources, and products that empower other neurodivergents (and their loved ones) to live freely and creatively. I'm not a doctor so please speak with your healthcare providers before implementing any recommendations I make on my channel.

Women are under-diagnosed due to lack of research. Please share any videos that are helpful to you so we can spread awareness and acceptance.

Music by Milky Wayvers ("Mountain")
https://soundcloud.com/freetousemusic/milky-wayvers-mountain

title: Things I Didn’t Know Were Autistic Stims #autisticadult
description:
I currently do all of these things and also did them as a kid! A lot of times women do these things covertly so they don't upset or annoy anyone and come across as more socially acceptable. Have you been stimming like me this whole time?

title: Autistic Clothing That Isn't Cheesy and Feels AWESOME!
description:
Join me in this video as I open the new Mom on the Spectrum merchandise (shop link below). Then I'll open the floor for questions and other autism-related discussion from the community. Looking forward to connecting with you! (If you're watching this post-stream, leave me a comment and let me know a little about you!).

🟥🟧🟨 SUPPORT THE CHANNEL 🟩🟦🟪
1️⃣ If you have been positively impacted by the channel and would like to show your support, you can do so in the following ways 🤗

🔵 PayPal: paypal.me/MomOnTheSpectrum
🟢 Venmo: @TaylorHeaton

2️⃣ MELTDOWN SURVIVAL GUIDE ⭐️✨🤩💃💪
Name Your Price for my custom-created 11-page Meltdown Survival Guide to help you better understand and regulate your nervous system.
👉 https://taylorheaton.gumroad.com/l/meltdownsurvivalguide

3️⃣ MOTS MERCHANDISE 👕🩳👚
Explore a wide selection of comfortable and sustainable clothing that supports your autistic lifestyle. 
https://momonthespectrum.teemill.com/

👏🏻 FREE 👏🏻 WAYS TO SHOW YOUR SUPPORT 🦾
🟥 SUBSCRIBE to the channel
🟧 LIKE the videos that are helpful to you
🟨 COMMENT in the comment section
🟩 Click the “bell” to be notified when I release new videos

🙏 Thank you immensely to those of you who have already donated, been active on the channel, and/or purchased MOTS resources!

💡 Resources ✅

👚 🩳 👕 Mom on the Spectrum Merchandise: https://momonthespectrum.teemill.com/

👂 Flare Earbuds for Sensory Overwhelm (Affiliate Partnership): https://www.flareaudio.com/momonthespectrum

💎 THE HEALING HIPPIES - Crystals and Gem Jewelry (Etsy Shop/Affiliate Partnership) USE CODE “HEALING” for 15% off Orders of $35+!:  https://www.etsy.com/shop/TheHealingHippies

Mom on the Spectrum website: https://www.momonthespectrum.net

Mom on the Spectrum downloadable content/resources: https://www.taylorheaton.gumroad.com

Mom on the Spectrum full YouTube Video Catalog: https://www.youtube.com/MomOnTheSpectrum

Meltdown Survival Guide: https://taylorheaton.gumroad.com/l/meltdownsurvivalguide



🌱🌿🪴🌱🌿🪴🌱🌿🪴🌱🌿🪴🌱🌿🪴

I'm Tay, a married mom of 2 who was diagnosed with Autism at 31 years old. This was after YEARS of therapy (and all of the self tests in the world!). My diagnosis has brought up questions, frustration, doubt, but most importantly, a new level of self compassion and understanding.

I'm here to share knowledge, resources, and products that empower other neurodivergents (and their loved ones) to live freely and creatively. I'm not a doctor so please speak with your healthcare providers before implementing any recommendations I make on my channel.

Women are under-diagnosed due to lack of research. Please share any videos that are helpful to you so we can spread awareness and acceptance.

title: Autistic Special Interests
description:
Special interests are an important component of life on the autism spectrum. More research is coming out that supports the need for autistic people to pursue their special interests on a regular basis, both in and out of the classroom (article linked below).

This video explores some of my own personal special interests and also ways that special interests improve the quality of life for those in the autistic community. 

Scroll down for a special offer regarding the jewelry that I share towards the end of the video! ⬇️

🌟 ⏩ Connect with others like you in an Autistic Community Group: https://taylorheaton.as.me/schedule.php

👉 ✴️ 1-on-1 Session with Taylor: https://taylorheaton.as.me/?appointmentType=42852597

localizations.en.title: Autistic Special Interests
localizations.en.description:
Special interests are an important component of life on the autism spectrum. More research is coming out that supports the need for autistic people to pursue their special interests on a regular basis, both in and out of the classroom (article linked below).

This video explores some of my own personal special interests and also ways that special interests improve the quality of life for those in the autistic community. 

Scroll down for a special offer regarding the jewelry that I share towards the end of the video! ⬇️

title: Autistic Meltdowns in Emergency Situations // Free Support Card
description:
Stressful events and emergencies are especially hard on autistic people: 
1. It may further impact our communication, cause a meltdown, and prevent us from being able to share information about our needs.
2. Many professionals are completely unaware of the needs of the autistic community.

I've created a free printable resource you can keep on hand to give to others in the event of an emergency so they know how to care for you. In this video we will go over what's on the card, how you can use this information in daily life, and how to download the card.

My goal is to spread awareness and acceptance for how autism presents according to real autistic people. YOU CAN HELP by subscribing to my channel and liking 👍 any videos that are helpful to you. Thank you for taking a quick moment to show your support! 🙏🤟🥳

🌟 ⏩ Connect with others like you in an Autistic Community Group: https://taylorheaton.as.me/schedule.php

👉 ✴️ 1-on-1 Session with Taylor: https://taylorheaton.as.me/?appointmentType=42852597

title: Encouragement and Support for Parents of Kids on the Spectrum
description:
Caring for children with special needs requires a high level of time, energy, patience, money, and self compassion. It can be an isolating journey that our fellow parents might dismiss or even invalidate. Burnout is a real issue, and learning to care for ourselves first can sometimes feel impossible. This video was designed with your health and well-being in mind, and I hope you’ll come back to it whenever you need a reminder that YOU are worthy of the same time, energy, and love that you give to others.

🌟 ⏩ Connect with others like you in an Autistic Community Group: https://taylorheaton.as.me/schedule.php

👉 ✴️ 1-on-1 Session with Taylor: https://taylorheaton.as.me/?appointmentType=42852597

💻 ONLINE COURSE How to Unmask: Cultivating Your True Autistic Self: https://taylorheaton.podia.com/how-to-unmask-finding-your-true-self-as-an-autistic-adult

❤️ 🧡 💛 MY FAVORITE THINGS 💚 💙 💜

Flare Earbuds for Sensory Overwhelm (affiliate link): https://www.flareaudio.com/momonthespectrum

Manta Weighted Sleep Mask (affiliate link): http://bit.ly/3n3l64I (use code: MOMONTHESPECTRUM for 10% off at checkout)

⬇️ Scroll down for timestamps and additional resources that may be helpful to you. ⬇️

PMB 680
Fort Worth, TX 76177

title: LIVE DISCUSSION: Autistic Traits in Women
description:
Join me Wednesday, April 6 at 12:00pm CST for a live discussion around one of my most recent videos, 16 Overlooked Autistic Traits in Women. You are invited to share questions, feedback, additional thoughts, etc. as we explore this topic together. I'll get to as many comments from the live feed as I can. You are welcome to use the Super Chat and Super Stickers features during the livestream as they are more likely to grab my attention in the event that we have a lot of comments coming in. 

If you have not yet seen my original video of autistic traits in women, you can find that here:
16 Overlooked Autistic Traits in Women: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xeZZH...

localizations.en.title: LIVE DISCUSSION: Autistic Traits in Women
localizations.en.description:
Join me Wednesday, April 6 at 12:00pm CST for a live discussion around one of my most recent videos, 16 Overlooked Autistic Traits in Women. You are invited to share questions, feedback, additional thoughts, etc. as we explore this topic together. I'll get to as many comments from the live feed as I can. You are welcome to use the Super Chat and Super Stickers features during the livestream as they are more likely to grab my attention in the event that we have a lot of comments coming in. 

If you have not yet seen my original video of autistic traits in women, you can find that here:

I'm Tay, a married mom of 2 who was diagnosed with Autism at 31 years old. This was after YEARS of therapy (and all of the self tests in the world!). My diagnosis has brought up questions, frustration, doubt, but most importantly, a new level of self compassion and understanding.

I'm here to share knowledge, resources, and products that empower other neurodivergents (and their loved ones) to live freely and creatively. I'm not a doctor so please speak with your healthcare providers before implementing any recommendations I make on my channel.

Women are under-diagnosed due to lack of research. Please share any videos that are helpful to you so we can spread awareness and acceptance.

title: Autism and ADHD in Women | 8 Areas of Frustration
description:
Both autism and ADHD are under-diagnosed in women because it tends to present differently (this can also apply to AFAB individuals). Also, until 2013, many medical providers did not believe the two conditions could exist simultaneously. This video covers the definition of both autism and ADHD, 8 areas of frustration in living with both conditions, similarities between the two conditions, and an important resource that can help you learn to better regulate your nervous system. 🧠🫁🫀

🌟 ⏩ Connect with others like you in an Autistic Community Group: https://taylorheaton.as.me/schedule.php

👉 ✴️ 1-on-1 Session with Taylor: https://taylorheaton.as.me/?appointmentType=42852597

💻 ONLINE COURSE How to Unmask: Cultivating Your True Autistic Self: https://taylorheaton.podia.com/how-to-unmask-finding-your-true-self-as-an-autistic-adult

❤️ 🧡 💛 MY FAVORITE THINGS 💚 💙 💜

ONO Fidget Roller (affiliate link): http://bit.ly/3xLZnQY (use code: MOMONTHESPECTRUM for 10% off at checkout)

Flare Earbuds for Sensory Overwhelm (affiliate link): https://www.flareaudio.com/momonthespectrum

Manta Weighted Sleep Mask (affiliate link): http://bit.ly/3n3l64I (use code: MOMONTHESPECTRUM for 10% off at checkout)

⬇️ Scroll down ⬇️  for timestamps to jump to a specific section PLUS a list of helpful resources for further study. 🧐

📪 Business Mailing Address 📬
Taylor Heaton
8901 Tehama Ridge Parkway, Suite 127
PMB 680
Fort Worth, TX 76177

DISCLAIMER: I am not a doctor nor psychologist. The purpose of this video is to share information that has been helpful to me as an autistic mom with ADHD. Please do not make any changes to your health without the help of a medical professional.

title: The 7 Types of ADD/ADHD According to Dr. Daniel Amen | ADHD and Autism in Women Series
description:
Autism and ADD/ADHD go hand in hand more often than you might think. According to recent studies, 30-50% of autistic people also show signs of ADD/ADHD, and about two-thirds of people with ADD/ADHD also show signs of being autistic*.

This video is the first video in my series on Autism and ADHD, and today we’re exploring the 7 types of ADD according to Neuropsychiatrist Dr. Daniel Amen. If you’re interested in learning about whether or not you fit one of the 7 types of ADD, make sure you stick around until the end of the video because I’ll be showing you how to take a simple test online that can give you results today. 

Keep in mind, these 7 types of ADD are not listed in the DSM-5, which many providers use to make a formal diagnosis. This exploration of Dr. Amen's work is more of an inquisitive look at how ADHD can present and is not a widely used set of criteria. 

⬇️ Scroll down ⬇️ for timestamps to jump to a specific section of the video AND a lengthy list of resources if you’re interested in further exploring this topic. 

🌟 ⏩ Connect with others like you in an Autistic Community Group: https://taylorheaton.as.me/schedule.php

💻 ONLINE COURSE How to Unmask: Cultivating Your True Autistic Self: https://taylorheaton.podia.com/how-to-unmask-finding-your-true-self-as-an-autistic-adult

👉 ✴️ 1-on-1 Session with Taylor: https://taylorheaton.as.me/?appointmentType=42852597

❤️ 🧡 💛 MY FAVORITE THINGS 💚 💙 💜

ONO Fidget Roller (affiliate link): http://bit.ly/3xLZnQY (use code: MOMONTHESPECTRUM for 10% off at checkout)

Flare Earbuds for Sensory Overwhelm (affiliate link): https://www.flareaudio.com/momonthespectrum

Manta Weighted Sleep Mask (affiliate link): http://bit.ly/3n3l64I (use code: MOMONTHESPECTRUM for 10% off at checkout)

DISCLAIMER: I am NOT a doctor or medical professional. Do not implement any suggestions in this video without the aid of a medical provider. 

📪 Business Mailing Address 📬
Taylor Heaton
8901 Tehama Ridge Parkway, Suite 127
PMB 680
Fort Worth, TX 76177

⏰ Timestamps 💻

Dr. Amen and SPECT scans (2:06)

Autism vs. ADD (3:45)

Why is it important to talk about ADD (4:54)

ADD Brain scan (5:38)

Type 1: Classic ADD/ADHD (6:25)

Type 2: Inattentive ADD (6:43)

Type 3: Overfocused ADD (7:03)

Type 4: Temporal Lobe ADD (7:34)

Type 5: Limbic ADD (7:47)

Type 6: Ring of Fire ADD (8:27)

Type 7: Anxious ADD (9:09)

Difference between ADD/ADHD diagnosis and just experiencing a few elements of it (9:27)

Can ADD be cured? (9:58)

ADD and Medication (10:38)

Tips for managing ADD/ADHD symptoms (11:13)

📕 Resources 💪

Mom on the Spectrum official website: https://www.momonthespectrum.life

Attention Deficit Disorder, Amen Clinics: https://www.amenclinics.com/conditions/adhd-add/#:~:text=Unlike%20traditional%20psychiatry%2C%20which%20rarely,Deficit%20Hyperactivity%20Disorder%20(ADHD).

*Are People With Autism Likely to Have ADD/ADHD: https://www.amenclinics.com/blog/are-people-with-autism-likely-to-have-add-adhd/#:~:text=At%20Amen%20Clinics%2C%20we%20have,or%20schedule%20a%20visit%20online.

ADD/ADHD Definition: https://www.additudemag.com/add-adhd-symptoms-difference/

Autism Definition: https://www.psychiatry.org/patients-families/autism/what-is-autism-spectrum-disorder#:~:text=Autism%20spectrum%20disorder%20(ASD)%20is,restricted%20interests%2C%20and%20repetitive%20behavior.

Amen Clinics: https://www.amenclinics.com/

Healing ADD (Book): https://www.amazon.com/Healing-ADD-Revised-Breakthrough-Program/dp/0425269973/ref=sr_1_1?crid=L2SSKXBIANDG&keywords=healing+ADD&qid=1647125991&sprefix=heali%2Caps%2C533&sr=8-1

Change Your Brain, Change Your Life (Book): https://www.amazon.com/Change-Your-Brain-Revised-Expanded/dp/110190464X/ref=sr_1_1?crid=3AEB36M7YZR50&keywords=change+your+brain+change+your+life&qid=1647126011&sprefix=change+your+brain%2Caps%2C117&sr=8-1

Elimination Diet (Mom on the Spectrum Video):https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=F-OejaubHhI

What is Autism? (Mom on the Spectrum Video): https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=F-OejaubHhI

🌿🪴🌱🌿🪴🌱🌿🪴🌱🌿🪴🌱🌿🪴🌱

I'm Tay, a married mom of 2 who was diagnosed with Autism at 31 years old. This was after YEARS of therapy (and all of the self tests in the world!). My diagnosis has brought up questions, frustration, doubt, but most importantly, a new level of self compassion and understanding.

I'm here to share knowledge, resources, and products that empower other neurodivergents (and their loved ones) to live freely and creatively. I'm not a doctor so please speak with your healthcare providers before implementing any recommendations I make on my channel.

Females are under-diagnosed due to lack of research. Please share any videos that are helpful to you so we can spread awareness and acceptance.

Music by Milky Wayvers ("Mountain")
https://soundcloud.com/freetousemusic/milky-wayvers-mountain

title: LIVE FAQ - Autistic Traits, Masking and More
description:
This LIVE discussion will be based on my most recent video: 16 Overlooked Female Autistic Traits. We will discuss the traits that have resonated the most with the community as well as others left of the list AND how female autistic traits can affect non-females as well. Livestreams are a way for us to connect to each other and I'm more than happy to accommodate other topic suggestions you may have. Just leave me a comment or send me an email! Looking forward to connecting with you soon.

title: 16 Overlooked Autistic Traits in Females / AFAB Individuals
description:
Autistic women are under-diagnosed due to a lack of research and testing in the female/AFAB population. This video is designed to give you a better understanding of commonly overlooked traits in autistic women in the hopes that together we can gain a better understanding of autism and create a better support network for the people who need it. 

List of traits starts at (4:32)

localizations.en.description:
Autistic women are under-diagnosed due to a lack of research and testing in the female/AFAB population. This video is designed to give you a better understanding of commonly overlooked traits in autistic women in the hopes that together we can gain a better understanding of autism and create a better support network for the people who need it.

title: Autism and Air Travel: Strategies for Navigating Social Anxiety and Sensory Overwhelm
description:
I recently returned from a trip where I flew for one of the first times since learning I am autistic. This new perspective really helped me understand just how stressful this process can be for people on the spectrum and allowed me to utilize several new tips and tricks for navigating these types of experiences. 

In this video I’ll walk you through the air travel process in stages while sharing some of my favorite resources along the way. At the end of the video I’ll open up the bag I took with me on the plane and show you what I packed to help manage social anxiety and sensory overwhelm.

I’d love to hear about your own tips and tricks for navigating air travel in the comments below!

Scroll down for timestamps to jump to a specific section of the video.

title: Travel Frustrations and Autism
description:
Traveling can really UNRAVEL me! One the one hand, I'm so excited to experience something new or visit a friend or see something I've always wanted to see like Times Square, but on the other hand, I'm terrified at the thought of leaving my stable routine, meticulously curated bed, and, let's be honest, my weighted blanket, which just doesn't travel well. In this video I'm exploring some of the frustrations of travel as someone on the autism spectrum.

💸 Support the Channel! 💪
Like, subscribe, comment and share. This helps my video show up for others like you and me who are looking for resources!

Check out my downloadable content: https://www.momonthespectrum.net

Donate through my Paypal: https:/www.paypal.me/MomOntheSpectrum

Thanks so much for your support! 

I'm Tay, a married mom of 2 who was diagnosed with Autism at 31 years old. This was after YEARS of therapy (and all of the self tests in the world!). My diagnosis has brought up questions, frustration, doubt, but most importantly, a new level of self compassion and understanding.

I'm here to share knowledge, resources, and products that empower other neurodivergents (and their loved ones) to live freely and creatively. I'm not a doctor so please speak with your healthcare providers before implementing any recommendations I make on my channel.

Females are under-diagnosed due to lack of research. Please share any videos that are helpful to you so we can spread awareness and acceptance.

Music by Milky Wayvers ("Mountain")
https://soundcloud.com/freetousemusic/milky-wayvers-mountain

Traveling can really UNRAVEL me! One the one hand, I'm so excited to experience something new or visit a friend or see something I've always wanted to see like Times Square, but on the other hand, I'm terrified at the thought of leaving my stable routine, meticulously curated bed, and, let's be honest, my weighted blanket, which just doesn't travel well. In this video I'm exploring some of the frustrations of travel as someone on the autism spectrum.

💸 Support the Channel! 💪
Like, subscribe, comment and share. This helps my video show up for others like you and me who are looking for resources!

Check out my downloadable content: https://www.momonthespectrum.net

Donate through my Paypal: https:/www.paypal.me/MomOntheSpectrum

Thanks so much for your support! 

I'm Tay, a married mom of 2 who was diagnosed with Autism at 31 years old. This was after YEARS of therapy (and all of the self tests in the world!). My diagnosis has brought up questions, frustration, doubt, but most importantly, a new level of self compassion and understanding.

I'm here to share knowledge, resources, and products that empower other neurodivergents (and their loved ones) to live freely and creatively. I'm not a doctor so please speak with your healthcare providers before implementing any recommendations I make on my channel.

Females are under-diagnosed due to lack of research. Please share any videos that are helpful to you so we can spread awareness and acceptance.

Music by Milky Wayvers ("Mountain")
https://soundcloud.com/freetousemusic/milky-wayvers-mountain

title: Autism and Religion: POST VIDEO DISCUSSION
description:
This video is the replay of a live discussion based on my video Autism and Religion (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6E2ndu7UWSE&t=3s). 

In this discussion we touch on traumas experienced by autistic people in their religious institutions, how autistic minds might approach religion differently, the stress of self advocacy as an autistic adult, and more. 

Please consider supporting my channel. Your engagement and support helps further the reach of my videos and allows them to show up for more people like you and me who are looking for additional resources to navigate the world of autism.

title: Autism and Imposter Syndrome
description:
Do you ever find yourself wondering things like, "Am I really all that I say I am?" or "When is everyone going to see through me and call me a fake?" Imposter Syndrome can affect anyone, but today we are focusing specifically on how it affects people on the spectrum. 🌈

For a better idea of the topics we'll cover in this video, scroll down to see an outline with timestamps you can click on to jump to any particular section that interests you. Or just watch the whole thing! You know I'm gonna have a pep talk in there somewhere. 💪

🌟 ⏩ Connect with others like you in an Autistic Community Group: https://taylorheaton.as.me/schedule.php

👉 ✴️ 1-on-1 Session with Taylor: https://taylorheaton.as.me/?appointmentType=42852597

💻 ONLINE COURSE How to Unmask: Cultivating Your True Autistic Self: https://taylorheaton.podia.com/how-to-unmask-finding-your-true-self-as-an-autistic-adult

I'm Tay, a married mom of 2 who was diagnosed with Autism at 31 years old. This was after YEARS of therapy (and all of the self tests in the world!). My diagnosis has brought up questions, frustration, doubt, but most importantly, a new level of self compassion and understanding.

I'm here to share knowledge, resources, and products that empower other neurodivergents (and their loved ones) to live freely and creatively. I'm not a doctor so please speak with your healthcare providers before implementing any recommendations I make on my channel.

Females are under-diagnosed due to lack of research. Please share any videos that are helpful to you so we can spread awareness and acceptance.

https://soundcloud.com/freetousemusic/milky-wayvers-mountain

title: What is Disability Discrimination and How to File a Complaint in 5 Minutes 😱🧾🙅‍♀️
description:
If you're like me, you may feel you've been discriminated against but feel unsure of what to do about it or how to voice your frustration. This video explores disability discrimination according to the Americans with Disabilities Act and offers definitions, examples, and online resources to help you file a complaint with the right organization. 🧾👩🏻‍⚖️👍

⬇️ Scroll down for timestamps to jump to a specific section of the video.

🌟 ⏩ Connect with others like you in an Autistic Community Group: https://taylorheaton.as.me/schedule.php

👉 ✴️ 1-on-1 Session with Taylor: https://taylorheaton.as.me/?appointmentType=42852597

💻 ONLINE COURSE How to Unmask: Cultivating Your True Autistic Self: https://taylorheaton.podia.com/how-to-unmask-finding-your-true-self-as-an-autistic-adult

❤️ 🧡 💛 MY FAVORITE THINGS 💚 💙 💜

ONO Fidget Roller (affiliate link): http://bit.ly/3xLZnQY (use code: MOMONTHESPECTRUM for 10% off at checkout)

Flare Earbuds for Sensory Overwhelm (affiliate link): https://www.flareaudio.com/momonthespectrum

Manta Weighted Sleep Mask (affiliate link): http://bit.ly/3n3l64I (use code: MOMONTHESPECTRUM for 10% off at checkout)

📪 Business Mailing Address 📬
Taylor Heaton
8901 Tehama Ridge Parkway, Suite 127
PMB 680
Fort Worth, TX 76177

🌟 MORE RESOURCES: https://www.momonthespectrum.life

⏰ TIMESTAMPS 🕰
Click on any of the blue timestamps to jump to that specific section of the video. 👇🖱💻

About the Channel (0:42)
One of my 2022 Goals (1:23)
My Personal Experience with Disability Discrimination (1:47)
Using the Term “Disability” (2:29)
I think THIS can be the most successful way to navigate discrimination 
Here’s What Happened To Me (4:07) 
What is Disability Discrimination? (4:43)
Types of Discrimination (5:29)
What is the Americans with Disabilities Act (6:55)
How the ADA defines a person with a disability (7:58)
Examples of Disabilities according to the ADA (8:26)
Areas in which ADA prevents discrimination (9:20)
Examples of Disability Rights Issues (9:36)
Filing a complaint (9:57)
Who can you file a complaint against? (10:15)
ADA Mediation Program (12:30)
How to File a Complaint (13:35)
Resources (15:20)
Autistic Meltdowns (15:58)

🖥 Links and Resources 📚

FREE Printable Emergency Card for Autistic People 
https://taylorheaton.gumroad.com/l/autisticicecard

Taylor's 11-Page Meltdown Survival Guide
https://taylorheaton.gumroad.com/l/meltdownsurvivalguide

The Job Interview Process According to an Autistic Person
https://youtu.be/5pdehl8OYWQ

Americans with Disabilities Act https://beta.ada.gov/

ADA Mediation Program https://beta.ada.gov/file-a-complaint/#mp

File a Complaint with Department of Justice https://civilrights.justice.gov/report/

To mail a complaint to the DOJ:
Fill out and send the paper ADA Complaint Form or a letter containing the same information, to:
U.S. Department of Justice
Civil Rights Division
950 Pennsylvania Avenue, NW
4CON, 9th Floor
Washington, DC 20530

File a Complaint with Equal Employment Opportunity Commission (EEOC) http://www.eeoc.gov/filing-charge-discrimination

File a Complaint with  Department of Transportation http://www.transportation.gov/airconsumer/complaints-alleging-discriminatory-treatment-against-disabled-travelers

File a Complaint with Department of Housing and Urban Development (HUD) https://www.hud.gov/program_offices/fair_housing_equal_opp/online-complaint

Discrimination in the Workplace https://www.workplacefairness.org/disability-discrimination#:~:text=Disability%20discrimination%20means%20treating%20individuals,can%20be%20against%20the%20law.

title: Executive Function and the Autistic Brain
description:
Up to 80% of people on the spectrum may struggle with executive function*. This video covers the definition of executive function, 12 mental processes associated with executive function, and strategies for working with your own specific strengths and weaknesses. Also, stay tuned at the end for the link to a questionnaire that can help give you insight into the executive functioning in your own brain! 🧠🤔🤯

localizations.en.title: Executive Function and the Autistic Brain
localizations.en.description:
Up to 80% of people on the spectrum may struggle with executive function*. This video covers the definition of executive function, 12 mental processes associated with executive function, and strategies for working with your own specific strengths and weaknesses. Also, stay tuned at the end for the link to a questionnaire that can help give you insight into the executive functioning in your own brain! 🧠🤔🤯

⬇️ Scroll down for timestamps to jump to a specific section of the video.

description:

In this video I explore some of the ways I unknowingly navigated high school to appear socially successful even though I didn’t feel that way inside.

title: Autism and Periods: How to Manage Sensory Overwhelm
description:
Prevalence of premenstrual syndrome in autism: a prospective observer-rated studyPrevalence of premenstrual syndrome in autism: a prospective observer-rated studyPeriods and Autism: This combination can bring up sensory issues, elevate stress, and more. People on the spectrum are prone to unique struggles and may have a harder time managing symptoms of PMS.

This video jumps into the 3 biggest challenges associated with periods and follows up with 9 simple hacks that may help you navigate this especially stressful time of the month. 🔴

Join us in the comments and share your own experiences! This is where the most learning happens. Also, please 👍 LIKE 👍 the video and ✴️ SUBSCRIBE ✴️ to the channel as that helps these videos show up for more people like US who are looking for support!

localizations.en.description:
Prevalence of premenstrual syndrome in autism: a prospective observer-rated studyPrevalence of premenstrual syndrome in autism: a prospective observer-rated studyPeriods and Autism: This combination can bring up sensory issues, elevate stress, and more. People on the spectrum are prone to unique struggles and may have a harder time managing symptoms of PMS.

This video jumps into the 3 biggest challenges associated with periods and follows up with 9 simple hacks that may help you navigate this especially stressful time of the month. 🔴

Join us in the comments and share your own experiences! This is where the most learning happens. Also, please 👍 LIKE 👍 the video and ✴️ SUBSCRIBE ✴️ to the channel as that helps these videos show up for more people like US who are looking for support!

title: Holiday Survival Tips for Mental Health // Neurodivergent + Autistic Adults
description:
The holidays can be a stressful time, especially for neurodivergent people (autistic people included in that category). Today we're having a LIVE discussion about:

What are the most stressful elements of holiday get-togethers?
How can we more successfully navigate these situations and avoid (or lessen) sensory overwhelm/meltdown?
What are some communication strategies for navigating uncomfortable conversations?
Which boundaries are appropriate to set and how can we set them in a respectful way?
How can we recover after events like Thanksgiving and Christmas?

Join us in the comments and share your own experiences! This is where the most learning happens. Also, please 👍 LIKE 👍 the video and ✴️ SUBSCRIBE ✴️ to the channel as that helps these videos show up for more people like US who are looking for support!

title: Spoon Theory and Autism
description:
Spoon Theory is a useful concept for sharing the invisible struggles experienced by people with certain illnesses, disabilities, and/or differing abilities.🥄 This video explores the origin of Spoon Theory as well as how it works and how you can apply it to your life as someone on the spectrum. Scroll down for timestamps you can click to jump to specific sections of the video. 👇

title: Autistic Stimming: Stim With Me! 👏🎶👂🪘💃
description:
Stimming is important for people on the spectrum because it helps us regulate our nervous system and process emotions/stress. Stimming comes in all shapes and sizes! Anything physical you do with your body to move energy outwards can be a stim. 

Today I invite you to get into something comfy, grab your favorite stimming items/activities, and join me as we DE-STRESS and have some fun! 

Rules for joining: Don't take yourself too seriously and get curious about what feels good to you! Try new things and don't forget to smile. Smiling automatically boosts your mood and helps alleviate stress, even if you don't feel like doing it! 

Come back to this video when you find yourself needing to regulate and you don't want to do it alone. :) I'll be here!

title: Just A Regular (Non-Savant) Autistic Person // Autism in Women
description:
One of the major stereotypes associated with autism is the profile of the “savant-genius.” This stereotype is reinforced through the media and lends an unrealistic view of people on the spectrum, where in reality, 10% have savant-like skills. 🤨 🤷‍♀️

This video explores some of the challenges of falling somewhere in the middle of the autism spectrum where needs can go unseen and unsupported. 💗

💻 ONLINE COURSE How to Unmask: Cultivating Your True Autistic Self: https://taylorheaton.podia.com/how-to-unmask-finding-your-true-self-as-an-autistic-adult

# WhatDreamsAreMadeOf # IsThisMyLife

⏰ TIMESTAMPS ⏱

0:01 Intro
0:31 Coming Up Against the “Savant” or “Genius” Stereotype 
0:55 Example of an Autistic Savant
1:19 I Wish I Had Super Cool Skills
1:43 Yes, I Did Well In School
1:55 We All Have Our Own Unique Challenges
2:08 It’s Kind of Like Being the Middle Child, Maybe? (No Disrespect to Middle Children!)
2:19 Sometimes I Feel Unseen
2:28 My Iceberg Analogy
2:58 Developing my Strengths
4:07 I Want To Be Able to Talk About the People in the Middle
4:22 Mom on the Spectrum Announcements 
4:47 Mini Pep Talk

📚 RESOURCES 👩‍🏫
What is An Autistic Savant?
https://www.appliedbehavioranalysisedu.org/what-is-an-autistic-savant/

🟥🟧🟨🟩🟦🟪

I'm Tay, a married mom of 2 who was diagnosed with Autism at 31 years old. This was after YEARS of therapy (and all of the self tests in the world!). My diagnosis has brought up questions, frustration, doubt, but most importantly, a new level of self compassion and understanding.

I'm here to share knowledge, resources, and products that empower other neurodivergents (and their loved ones) to live freely and creatively. I'm not a doctor so please speak with your healthcare providers before implementing any recommendations I make on my channel.

Females are under-diagnosed due to lack of research. Please share any videos that are helpful to you so we can spread awareness and acceptance.

Music by Milky Wayvers ("Mountain")
https://soundcloud.com/freetousemusic/milky-wayvers-mountain

#autism #actuallyautistic #aspergers
caption: false
localizations.en.title: Just A Regular (Non-Savant) Autistic Person // Autism in Women
localizations.en.description:
One of the major stereotypes associated with autism is the profile of the “savant-genius.” This stereotype is reinforced through the media and lends an unrealistic view of people on the spectrum, where in reality, 10% have savant-like skills. 🤨 🤷‍♀️

This video explores some of the challenges of falling somewhere in the middle of the autism spectrum where needs can go unseen and unsupported. 💗

💻 ONLINE COURSE How to Unmask: Cultivating Your True Autistic Self: https://taylorheaton.podia.com/how-to-unmask-finding-your-true-self-as-an-autistic-adult

🌟 ⏩ Connect with others like you in an Autistic Community Group: https://taylorheaton.as.me/schedule.php

title: Why Do I Feel More Autistic Now?
description:
Navigating autism as an adult can be confusing, especially when you might find yourself wondering, am I MORE autistic than I used to be? And if so, why? 

In this video we’ll explore some areas where one might be prone to feel “more autistic” as time goes on and why this might be so. Scroll down for timestamps you can click to jump to specific video sections. 👇

💻 ONLINE COURSE How to Unmask: Cultivating Your True Autistic Self: https://taylorheaton.podia.com/how-to-unmask-finding-your-true-self-as-an-autistic-adult

Manta Weighted Sleep Mask (affiliate link): http://bit.ly/3n3l64I (use code: MOMONTHESPECTRUM for 10% off at checkout)

Taylor Heaton
8901 Tehama Ridge Parkway, Suite 127
PMB 680
Fort Worth, TX 76177

🌟 MORE RESOURCES: https://www.momonthespectrum.life

title: Making Friends As An Autistic Adult: Simple Tips and Guidelines To Keep Things Safe and Fun 😎👋🕺
description:
Making friends can be challenging for everyone, but especially for autistic adults. We have social differences that tend to make things a little more complicated. In this video we will explore 5 simple tips to make the process of connecting with others a little smoother and more accessible, no matter where you fall on the spectrum. 

💻 ONLINE COURSE How to Unmask: Cultivating Your True Autistic Self: https://taylorheaton.podia.com/how-to-unmask-finding-your-true-self-as-an-autistic-adult

📪 Business Mailing Address 📬
Taylor Heaton
8901 Tehama Ridge Parkway, Suite 127
PMB 680
Fort Worth, TX 76177

🌟 ⏩ Connect with others like you in an Autistic Community Group: https://taylorheaton.as.me/schedule.php

👉 ✴️ 1-on-1 Session with Taylor: https://taylorheaton.as.me/?appointmentType=42852597

❤️ 🧡 💛 MY FAVORITE THINGS 💚 💙 💜

ONO Fidget Roller (affiliate link): http://bit.ly/3xLZnQY (use code: MOMONTHESPECTRUM for 10% off at checkout)

Flare Earbuds for Sensory Overwhelm (affiliate link): https://www.flareaudio.com/momonthespectrum

Manta Weighted Sleep Mask (affiliate link): http://bit.ly/3n3l64I (use code: MOMONTHESPECTRUM for 10% off at checkout)

🌟 MORE RESOURCES: https://www.momonthespectrum.life

🚨TWO THINGS I FORGOT TO MENTION IN THE VIDEO:🚨
There are two Reddit pages I found that might be interesting places to explore and an awesome app that can be helpful for communicating called Marco Polo!

REDDIT
Friends on the Spectrum: https://www.reddit.com/r/FriendsOnTheSpectrum/
Autistic Adults: https://www.reddit.com/r/AutisticAdults/

MARCO POLO
Recorded video chats that allow you to interact face-to-face in a non-live format. Watch your friends' responses at your convenience without the social pressure of immediately responding. The app is free.
https://www.marcopolo.me/

🟥🟧🟨 SUPPORT THE CHANNEL 🟩🟦🟪
1️⃣ If you have been positively impacted by the channel and would like to show your support, you can do so in the following ways:

🟢 Venmo: @TaylorHeaton
🔵 PayPal: paypal.me/MomOnTheSpectrum

2️⃣ MELTDOWN SURVIVAL GUIDE ⭐️✨🤩💃💪
Name Your Price for my custom-created 11-page Meltdown Survival Guide to help you make it through the tough times.
👉 https://taylorheaton.gumroad.com/l/meltdownsurvivalguide

👏🏻 FREE 👏🏻 WAYS TO SHOW YOUR SUPPORT 🦾

# WhatDreamsAreMadeOf # IsThisMyLife


Please SUBSCRIBE to my channel and LIKE this video. It helps my videos show up for other people like you and me AND helps support me as I continue making videos!

📱Share your friend-making tips with me in the comments! 💃

⏱ TIMESTAMPS ➡️
Click any of the blue timestamps below to jump to a specific section in the video.

Intro (1:30)
Making Friends Can Be Challenging! (2:00)
Be The Friend You Want to Find (2:31)
Reconnect With Old Friends (4:27)
Support a Cause (5:21)
Find a Group that Shares Your Special Interest (5:59)
Join an Exercise Group (7:24)
Hang Out In Places That Attract The Types of Friends You Seek (8:01)
Interact in a Way That Feels Good To You (8:59)
Talk Through Your Experience (9:31)
Making Friends Takes Time (10:09)
MOTS Community (11:10)
Response from Medication and Autism Video (11:45)
My Own Friendships (12:15)
Play Up Your Strengths (13:17)
Upcoming Video (14:01)

💻 RESOURCES 📚
Cup of Sunshine Tea: https://www.traditionalmedicinals.com/products/cup-of-sunshine-tea/

Meetup.com: https://www.meetup.com/home/

Embrace Autism: embrace-autism.com
Great resource for all things Autism

Asperger Experts: https://www.aspergerexperts.com/
Inviting and safe autistic community with helpful resources.

___________________________________


I'm Tay, a married mom of 2 who was diagnosed with Autism at 31 years old. This was after YEARS of therapy (and all of the self tests in the world!). My diagnosis has brought up questions, frustration, doubt, but most importantly, a new level of self compassion and understanding.

I'm here to share knowledge, resources, and products that empower other neurodivergents (and their loved ones) to live freely and creatively. I'm not a doctor so please speak with your healthcare providers before implementing any recommendations I make on my channel.

Females are under-diagnosed due to lack of research. Please share any videos that are helpful to you so we can spread awareness and acceptance.

Music by Milky Wayvers ("Mountain")
https://soundcloud.com/freetousemusic/milky-wayvers-mountain
