title: Medication and Autism: Options, Benefits and Warnings ⚠️💊
description:
➡️Today we're exploring a tricky subject. What are our options when it comes to medicating for relief from autistic challenges?

As a reminder, I'm NOT a doctor, and any decisions you make regarding medication should be made with your health care provider. Do not stop or start taking medications without medical supervision. 

This video is primarily to share my own experiences with medication and how it has both benefitted and hindered me, in the hopes that it will help you find a treatment path with your medical provider that works for YOU.

💻 ONLINE COURSE How to Unmask: Cultivating Your True Autistic Self: https://taylorheaton.podia.com/how-to-unmask-finding-your-true-self-as-an-autistic-adult

🌟 ⏩ Connect with others like you in an Autistic Community Group: https://taylorheaton.as.me/schedule.php

👉 ✴️ 1-on-1 Session with Taylor: https://taylorheaton.as.me/?appointmentType=42852597

❤️ 🧡 💛 MY FAVORITE THINGS 💚 💙 💜

ONO Fidget Roller (affiliate link): http://bit.ly/3xLZnQY (use code: MOMONTHESPECTRUM for 10% off at checkout)

Flare Earbuds for Sensory Overwhelm (affiliate link): https://www.flareaudio.com/momonthespectrum

Manta Weighted Sleep Mask (affiliate link): http://bit.ly/3n3l64I (use code: MOMONTHESPECTRUM for 10% off at checkout)

📪 Business Mailing Address 📬
Taylor Heaton
8901 Tehama Ridge Parkway, Suite 127
PMB 680
Fort Worth, TX 76177

🌟 MORE RESOURCES: https://www.momonthespectrum.life

📱Click on the any of the timestamps below to jump to a specific section of the video and be sure to checkout the resources below that for articles and products mentioned. 🖥

⏱ TIMESTAMPS 👾
Click on any blue timestamp to jump to that section of the video.

Autism Doesn’t Need a Cure (1:01)
Autism and Finding Homeostasis (1:42)
I’m Not a Doctor! (2:40)
My Goal With This Video (2:59)
The Stigma of Medication (3:29)
Autistic Challenges that Medication Might Alleviate (4:42)
3 Types of Drugs We’ll Be Covering (5:04)
Antidepressants (5:09)
My Experience with Antidepressants (6:46)
Serotonin Differences and Paradoxical Effects of Medication in Autistic People (6:55)
Beta Blockers (10:13)
Stimulants (11:02)
Autism and ADHD (11:16)
Stimulant Disclaimer (11:32)
The Plus Side of Stimulants (12:21)
Stimulant Side Effects (12:58)
Interoception (14:02)
Dark Thoughts and Suicidal Ideation (16:30)
Mindfulness (17:22)
From Thinking Mind to Experiential Mind (18:18)
Bottom Line: You do YOU! (20:05)

✍️ RESOURCES (Articles) 📓

➡️ Temple Grandin: Inside ASD - Medication (This is the article I’m reading from in the Antidepressant section of the video where I’m talking really fast. 🙃)
https://www.autism.org/temple-grandin-inside-asd/#medication

➡️ The serotonin system in autism spectrum disorder: from biomarker to animal models
https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC4824539/

➡️ Paradoxical reactions elicited by diazepam in children with classic autism
https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/2826308/

📚 RESOURCES (Books) 📖

Peace is Every Step
Thich Nhat Hanh: Peace is Every Step
https://www.secondsale.com/p/peace-is-every-step-the-path-of-mindfulness-in-everyday-life/1925725

Pema Chodron: When Things Fall Apart
https://www.amazon.com/When-Things-Fall-Apart-Difficult-ebook/dp/B00BBXJH2C/ref=sr_1_1?dchild=1&keywords=when+things+fall+apart&qid=1633885723&s=books&sr=1-1

Deepak Chopra: The Seven Spiritual Laws of Success https://www.amazon.com/Seven-Spiritual-Laws-Success-Pocketbook/dp/1878424718

Eckhart Tolle: The Power of Now
https://www.secondsale.com/p/the-power-of-now-a-guide-to-spiritual-enlightenment/1908840

☄️RESOURCES (Products) 😎

Weighted Exercise ball
https://www.amazon.com/ProsourceFit-Weighted-Exercise-Strength-Training/dp/B07V8LBVKR/ref=sr_1_1?dchild=1&keywords=weighted+ball+3+lb&qid=1633885788&s=books&sr=1-1

_____________________________________________

I'm Tay, a married mom of 2 who was diagnosed with Autism at 31 years old. This was after YEARS of therapy (and all of the self tests in the world!). My diagnosis has brought up questions, frustration, doubt, but most importantly, a new level of self compassion and understanding.

I'm here to share knowledge, resources, and products that empower other neurodivergents (and their loved ones) to live freely and creatively. I'm not a doctor so please speak with your healthcare providers before implementing any recommendations I make on my channel.

Females are under-diagnosed due to lack of research. Please share any videos that are helpful to you so we can spread awareness and acceptance.

Music by Milky Wayvers ("Mountain")
https://soundcloud.com/freetousemusic/milky-wayvers-mountain

Background thumbnail Photo by Hal Gatewood on Unsplash

title: Autism Starter Kit for Newly Diagnosed Adults ❤️‍🩹🤗⛑
description:
Receiving an autism diagnosis as an adult can be disorienting and confusing. 🤔You’re the same person, but seeing yourself in a different light after years of thinking you were just having a hard time fitting in. Where do you begin navigating the world with this new information? Which resources do you need in order to allow the truest version of yourself to shine through? 🤷‍♀️🧸

In this video, Tay shares a few practical tips you can implement today as you learn how to support yourself after an adult autism diagnosis. 👊

💻 ONLINE COURSE How to Unmask: Cultivating Your True Autistic Self: https://taylorheaton.podia.com/how-to-unmask-finding-your-true-self-as-an-autistic-adult

🌟 ⏩ Connect with others like you in an Autistic Community Group: https://taylorheaton.as.me/schedule.php

👉 ✴️ 1-on-1 Session with Taylor: https://taylorheaton.as.me/?appointmentType=42852597

Manta Weighted Sleep Mask (affiliate link): http://bit.ly/3n3l64I (use code: MOMONTHESPECTRUM for 10% off at checkout)

# WhatDreamsAreMadeOf # IsThisMyLife


Click on any of the blue timestamps below to jump to a specific section and please ⭐️SUBSCRIBE ⭐️to help support my channel and allow my videos to show up more easily for people like us! 

💻TIMESTAMPS ⏰
(click a blue time marker to jump to a specific section)
What is stimming? (0:29)
I just got an autism diagnosis. Now what? (0:36)
You are ok. (1:04)
You don’t have to share your diagnosis. (1:08)
You need time alone. (1:32)
Give yourself permission to stim. (2:03)
The way you experience the world is different and that's ok. (2:36)
Special interests are important. (3:04)
Setting boundaries is essential. (3:39)
One step at a time. (4:09)

📱RESOURCES 🤳
Sensory Toys and Tips for Sensory Regulation (video):https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BtlN-a78NrE&t=2s

Yoga for Sensory Regulation/Autistic Adults (video): https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Iq9ycuQphDA&t=459s

Balancing Boundaries and Social Events (video): https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gI7x982Nxb0&t=36s

Autistic Meltdowns and Shutdowns (video): https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JFvNmBXcvCQ&t=435s

Aaron's Thinking Putty (product - not sponsored):
https://www.amazon.com/Crazy-Aarons-Scented-Thinking-Putty/dp/B086BSBTT6/ref=sr_1_12?dchild=1&keywords=aaron%27s+thinking+putty&qid=1632947303&sr=8-12

____________

I'm Tay, a married mom of 2 who was diagnosed with Autism at 31 years old. This was after YEARS of therapy (and all of the self tests in the world!). My diagnosis has brought up questions, frustration, doubt, but most importantly, a new level of self compassion and understanding.

I'm here to share knowledge, resources, and products that empower other neurodivergents (and their loved ones) to live freely and creatively. I'm not a doctor so please speak with your healthcare providers before implementing any recommendations I make on my channel.

Females are under-diagnosed due to both lack of research and awareness. Please share any videos that are helpful to you so we can spread awareness and acceptance.

Music by Milky Wayvers ("Mountain")
https://soundcloud.com/freetousemusic/milky-wayvers-mountain\

Thumbnail Photo by shawnee wilborn on Unsplash

title: Alexithymia and Identifying Emotions in Autistic Adults
description:
Alexithymia is a condition that affects many people on the spectrum. It affects our ability to label and/or communicate about the emotions we are experiencing. 😵‍💫

After seeing a visual representation of emotional body mapping, it helped me learn how to distinguish some of my emotions more quickly. 🗺

title: Relationship Challenges On the Spectrum: Alone Time, Social Differences, & How Autism Changes Things
description:
Being on the spectrum comes with its own set of challenges, especially in the context of relationships. Today I'm sharing 7 autistic challenges I face on a daily basis when it comes to navigating my relationship with my allistic (non-autistic) husband. 👩‍❤️‍👨

https://embrace-autism.com/alexithymia-and-autism-guide/

__________________

I'm Tay, a married mom of 2 who was diagnosed with Autism at 31 years old. This was after YEARS of therapy (and all of the self tests in the world!). My diagnosis has brought up questions, frustration, doubt, but most importantly, a new level of self compassion and understanding.

I'm here to share knowledge, resources, and products that empower other neurodivergents (and their loved ones) to live freely and creatively. I'm not a doctor so please speak with your healthcare providers before implementing any recommendations I make on my channel.

Females are under-diagnosed due to lack of research. Please share any videos that are helpful to you so we can spread awareness and acceptance.

Music by Milky Wayvers ("Mountain")
https://soundcloud.com/freetousemusic/milky-wayvers-mountain

localizations.en.title: Relationship Challenges On the Spectrum: Alone Time, Social Differences, & How Autism Changes Things
localizations.en.description:
Being on the spectrum comes with its own set of challenges, especially in the context of relationships. Today I'm sharing 7 autistic challenges I face on a daily basis when it comes to navigating my relationship with my allistic (non-autistic) husband. 👩‍❤️‍👨

title: The Interview Process and How It Affects Neurodivergent Minds  👩🏼‍💻😖 (Thoughts from an Autistic Mom)
description:
Last week I had my first interview since deciding to switch careers and it was a DOOZY. I experienced how the process is set up to mirror neurotypical needs and how certain requirements can jeopardize success for neurodivergent minds. We've got to make some changes to even the playing field and help companies hire a more fair representation of humans with all types of skills and abilities. 🙏🗄💼

💻 ONLINE COURSE How to Unmask: Cultivating Your True Autistic Self: https://taylorheaton.podia.com/how-to-unmask-finding-your-true-self-as-an-autistic-adult

🌟 ⏩ Connect with others like you in an Autistic Community Group: https://taylorheaton.as.me/schedule.php

👉 ✴️ 1-on-1 Session with Taylor: https://taylorheaton.as.me/?appointmentType=42852597

❤️ 🧡 💛 MY FAVORITE THINGS 💚 💙 💜

ONO Fidget Roller (affiliate link): http://bit.ly/3xLZnQY (use code: MOMONTHESPECTRUM for 10% off at checkout)

Flare Earbuds for Sensory Overwhelm (affiliate link): https://www.flareaudio.com/momonthespectrum

Manta Weighted Sleep Mask (affiliate link): http://bit.ly/3n3l64I (use code: MOMONTHESPECTRUM for 10% off at checkout)

Scroll down for a list of time markers to jump to specific video sections.

I'd love to hear in the comments about your own experiences with Job Interviews and any suggestions you have to make the process more accessible for people on the spectrum (and all neurodivergent minds).

📪 Business Mailing Address 📬
Taylor Heaton
8901 Tehama Ridge Parkway, Suite 127
PMB 680
Fort Worth, TX 76177

🌟 MORE RESOURCES: https://www.momonthespectrum.life

title: Navigating the Pandemic as an Autistic Mom
description:
Is it just me or does this school year feel harder than COVID Round 1? There's just something... different about it this time. 😖🤦‍♀️

Today I'm exploring what's behind these differences, the challenges of sending kids to school (or not) and how to manage it all in the midst of uncertainty. 📅 😥

💻 ONLINE COURSE How to Unmask: Cultivating Your True Autistic Self: https://taylorheaton.podia.com/how-to-unmask-finding-your-true-self-as-an-autistic-adult

🌟 ⏩ Connect with others like you in an Autistic Community Group: https://taylorheaton.as.me/schedule.php

👉 ✴️ 1-on-1 Session with Taylor: https://taylorheaton.as.me/?appointmentType=42852597

❤️ 🧡 💛 MY FAVORITE THINGS 💚 💙 💜

ONO Fidget Roller (affiliate link): http://bit.ly/3xLZnQY (use code: MOMONTHESPECTRUM for 10% off at checkout)

Flare Earbuds for Sensory Overwhelm (affiliate link): https://www.flareaudio.com/momonthespectrum

Manta Weighted Sleep Mask (affiliate link): http://bit.ly/3n3l64I (use code: MOMONTHESPECTRUM for 10% off at checkout)

📪 Business Mailing Address 📬
Taylor Heaton
8901 Tehama Ridge Parkway, Suite 127
PMB 680
Fort Worth, TX 76177

🌟 MORE RESOURCES: https://www.momonthespectrum.life

# WhatDreamsAreMadeOf # IsThisMyLife

Please SUBSCRIBE to my channel! It's the best way to help these videos show up for others like us who are looking for them. 🙏

⏰ Click any of the timestamps below to jump to a particular section:

Something to celebrate! 🎉 (0:49)
What’s different about the autistic community 👯‍♂️ (1:53)
Furry interruption! 😸 (3:24)
COVID and change in routine 🤯 (3:45)
COVID Round 1 🦠 (4:08)
What’s different this time around 🤷‍♀️ (4:32)
How did I not see this coming? 👀 (5:45)
Fear of sickness 🤒 (6:28)
To Mask or Not to Mask 😷 (7:30)
Sickness and Perseveration 💭 (7:57)
Why we need to talk about this 🗣 (8:34)
This school year feels different 🚌 (9:14)
What if it all falls apart? 😫 (10:56)
Look for the helpers ⛑ (11:37)
Mental Healthcare 🏥 (12:43)
COVID and Therapy 👩‍⚕️ (13:05)
Self care reminders ⏱ (14:28)
Lesson from a monk 📚 (15:18)
Breathing meditation 🧘🏼‍♀️ (16:29)

💻 Resources 📱
Meltdown 2.0 (Video): https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hAufbomH2lg&t=376s
Top Autistic Strengths (Video): https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=eUZUk5wC8Mo&t=86s
Therapy for Autistic Adults (Video): https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qybY2iFis3Q&t=5s

__________________

I'm Tay, a married mom of 2 who was diagnosed with Autism at 31 years old. This was after YEARS of therapy (and all of the self tests in the world!). My diagnosis has brought up questions, frustration, doubt, but most importantly, a new level of self compassion and understanding.

I'm here to share knowledge, resources, and products that empower other neurodivergents (and their loved ones) to live freely and creatively. I'm not a doctor so please speak with your healthcare providers before implementing any recommendations I make on my channel.

Females are under-diagnosed due to lack of research. Please share any videos that are helpful to you so we can spread awareness and acceptance.

Music by Milky Wayvers ("Mountain")
https://soundcloud.com/freetousemusic/milky-wayvers-mountain

title: Thoughts Mid-Shutdown: Parenting, Screen Time, & How Youtube Can Support Neurodivergent Creators👾
description:
🙊 I wasn’t planning on making another meltdown video this soon but...here I am, mid-meltdown and wanting to share my observations in the spirit of exploration and learning. Meltdowns are kind of fascinating to me and I’m starting to gain more vocabulary and awareness to be able to communicate about them, even as they happen. I think if we can better understand how we end up in meltdown mode, we can learn how to plan ahead to lessen the effects or maybe even avoid some altogether. 🤞

🗣 Because I got on my soapbox (what's a soapbox anyway?), I’m also tackling the subject of kids and screen time plus how Youtube can better serve neurodivergent creators (check timestamps below to jump to a specific section).💻

❓What are some meltdown triggers for you? What things or activities are helpful to you in the recovery process? ❤️‍🩹

💻 ONLINE COURSE How to Unmask: Cultivating Your True Autistic Self: https://taylorheaton.podia.com/how-to-unmask-finding-your-true-self-as-an-autistic-adult

🌟 ⏩ Connect with others like you in an Autistic Community Group: https://taylorheaton.as.me/schedule.php

👉 ✴️ 1-on-1 Session with Taylor: https://taylorheaton.as.me/?appointmentType=42852597

❤️ 🧡 💛 MY FAVORITE THINGS 💚 💙 💜

ONO Fidget Roller (affiliate link): http://bit.ly/3xLZnQY (use code: MOMONTHESPECTRUM for 10% off at checkout)

Flare Earbuds for Sensory Overwhelm (affiliate link): https://www.flareaudio.com/momonthespectrum

Manta Weighted Sleep Mask (affiliate link): http://bit.ly/3n3l64I (use code: MOMONTHESPECTRUM for 10% off at checkout)

🌟 MORE RESOURCES: https://www.momonthespectrum.life

title: DSM-5 Autism Criteria | I wish I knew THIS sooner!
description:
What is autism? Can you tell for sure if someone is on the spectrum? And are the examples we see in the media an accurate representation of autistic individuals? I believe part of the reason it took me 31 years to discover I’m autistic is that I didn’t have an accurate understanding of what autism REALLY is. 

Today we’re diving into the diagnostic criteria presented for autism in the DSM-5 to gain a better understanding of autistic experiences. I’ll also share my own description of autism based off of my personal experience and those of other autistic adults whom I’ve studied. 

PLUS: The GAMECHANGER diagnostic condition that opened my eyes to why it took me so long to realize I was autistic.👏🏻

💻 ONLINE COURSE How to Unmask: Cultivating Your True Autistic Self: https://taylorheaton.podia.com/how-to-unmask-finding-your-true-self-as-an-autistic-adult

🌟 ⏩ Connect with others like you in an Autistic Community Group: https://taylorheaton.as.me/schedule.php

👉 ✴️ 1-on-1 Session with Taylor: https://taylorheaton.as.me/?appointmentType=42852597

❤️ 🧡 💛 MY FAVORITE THINGS 💚 💙 💜

ONO Fidget Roller (affiliate link): http://bit.ly/3xLZnQY (use code: MOMONTHESPECTRUM for 10% off at checkout)

Flare Earbuds for Sensory Overwhelm (affiliate link): https://www.flareaudio.com/momonthespectrum

Manta Weighted Sleep Mask (affiliate link): http://bit.ly/3n3l64I (use code: MOMONTHESPECTRUM for 10% off at checkout)

📪 Business Mailing Address 📬
Taylor Heaton
8901 Tehama Ridge Parkway, Suite 127
PMB 680
Fort Worth, TX 76177

🌟 MORE RESOURCES: https://www.momonthespectrum.life

💻  TIME MARKERS (Click the blue link to jump to that section) ➡️

Misunderstanding the term “autism” (1:22)
Tay’s description of autism (2:59)
#actuallyautistic (4:30)
Disorder vs. Difference (4:53)
What is the DSM? (5:12)
Notable changes in the DSM-5 (5:45)
DSM-5 Diagnostic criteria (6:01)
Deficits in social communication and social interaction (6:19)
Deficits in noverbal communicative behaviors (6:45)
Deficits in relationships (8:35)
Restricted and repetitive behaviors (10:17)
Repetitive motor movements, use of objects, or speech (10:25)
Insistence on sameness (11:22)
Restricted/fixated interests (12:21)
Hyper/Hyporeactivity to sensory input (13:03)
Final conditions (13:53)
GAME CHANGER CONDITION (14:03)
Important info regarding DSM-IV diagnoses (15:24)
Where do we go from here? (16:05)

📖 If you learn something from this video, please consider sharing it with someone to help raise awareness and acceptance. If I would’ve had this information sooner, it would have radically affected my life! 💪

📙📓 RESOURCES 💾📘

➡️ “Epidemiology of autistic disorder and other pervasive developmental disorders”: https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/16401144/

➡️ “Diagnostic Criteria for 299.00 Autism Spectrum Disorder”: https://www.cdc.gov/ncbddd/autism/hcp-dsm.html

➡️ The BEST Sensory Toys and Tips for Autistic Adults: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BtlN-a78NrE&t=2s

➡️ Autism DX at 31: How Did I Get Here?: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dC4pd0EbQSY&t=401s

➡️ The Upsetting History Behind the Term “Aspergers”: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Cc0QebZOqio&t=15s

🌈 TAY’S DESCRIPTION OF AUTISM 💃

Autism is a neurodevelopmental condition characterized by social differences, repetitive behaviors, adherence to rules and routines, intensely focused special interests, unique sensory experiences/needs, and a restless mind. This can feel like a frustrating and continual processing or decoding of the world around them. Balancing these symptoms often leads to meltdowns where it feels like one is incapable of processing more sensory input or shutdowns where one needs to retreat to a silent place for an extended period of time before rejoining in normal activities. 

Many times these symptoms are imperceptible to others who are not autistic due to camouflaging or masking. Camouflaging/masking is the process through which autistic people consciously or subconsciously behave in order to appear more socially appropriate. This can affect body language, tone of voice, eye contact, word choice, and more.

People on the spectrum tend to find comfort and relief from overstimulation and overthinking by spending time alone, balancing their sensory experiences, stimming, and working on/studying special interests.

🌿🌱🪴🍃🌿🌱🪴🍃🌿🌱🪴🍃

https://soundcloud.com/freetousemusic/milky-wayvers-mountain

8901 Tehama Ridge Parkway, Suite 127

💻  TIME MARKERS (Click the blue link to jump to that section) ➡️

Misunderstanding the term “autism” (1:22)
Tay’s description of autism (2:59)
#actuallyautistic (4:30)
Disorder vs. Difference (4:53)
What is the DSM? (5:12)
Notable changes in the DSM-5 (5:45)
DSM-5 Diagnostic criteria (6:01)
Deficits in social communication and social interaction (6:19)
Deficits in noverbal communicative behaviors (6:45)
Deficits in relationships (8:35)
Restricted and repetitive behaviors (10:17)
Repetitive motor movements, use of objects, or speech (10:25)
Insistence on sameness (11:22)
Restricted/fixated interests (12:21)
Hyper/Hyporeactivity to sensory input (13:03)
Final conditions (13:53)
GAME CHANGER CONDITION (14:03)
Important info regarding DSM-IV diagnoses (15:24)
Where do we go from here? (16:05)

📖 If you learn something from this video, please consider sharing it with someone to help raise awareness and acceptance. If I would’ve had this information sooner, it would have radically affected my life! 💪

📙📓 RESOURCES 💾📘

➡️ “Epidemiology of autistic disorder and other pervasive developmental disorders”: https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/16401144/

➡️ “Diagnostic Criteria for 299.00 Autism Spectrum Disorder”: https://www.cdc.gov/ncbddd/autism/hcp-dsm.html

➡️ The BEST Sensory Toys and Tips for Autistic Adults: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BtlN-a78NrE&t=2s

➡️ Autism DX at 31: How Did I Get Here?: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dC4pd0EbQSY&t=401s

➡️ The Upsetting History Behind the Term “Aspergers”: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Cc0QebZOqio&t=15s

🌈 TAY’S DESCRIPTION OF AUTISM 💃

Autism is a neurodevelopmental condition characterized by social differences, repetitive behaviors, adherence to rules and routines, intensely focused special interests, unique sensory experiences/needs, and a restless mind. This can feel like a frustrating and continual processing or decoding of the world around them. Balancing these symptoms often leads to meltdowns where it feels like one is incapable of processing more sensory input or shutdowns where one needs to retreat to a silent place for an extended period of time before rejoining in normal activities. 

Many times these symptoms are imperceptible to others who are not autistic due to camouflaging or masking. Camouflaging/masking is the process through which autistic people consciously or subconsciously behave in order to appear more socially appropriate. This can affect body language, tone of voice, eye contact, word choice, and more.

People on the spectrum tend to find comfort and relief from overstimulation and overthinking by spending time alone, balancing their sensory experiences, stimming, and working on/studying special interests.

title: YOGA FOR AUTISTIC ADULTS 🧠 🧘🏾‍♂️ ✌️  (Relief from Sensory Overwhelm and Overstimulation)
description:
People on the spectrum often find themselves *overthinking*. The way we process information through our senses can be overwhelming and add extra work to our already overworked brain. But there is hope! Mindful practices like yoga can help us de-stress, refocus our wandering thoughts, and find a sense of calm and ease.

This is a two part video. The first part focuses on the specifics of how yoga can benefit people on the spectrum by stimulating our Parasympathetic Nervous System. The second part is a 30-minute yoga practice that’s accessible for all skill levels, even beginners! And there’s no sweating involved, promise. 

💻 ONLINE COURSE How to Unmask: Cultivating Your True Autistic Self: https://taylorheaton.podia.com/how-to-unmask-finding-your-true-self-as-an-autistic-adult

🌟 ⏩ Connect with others like you in an Autistic Community Group: https://taylorheaton.as.me/schedule.php

# WhatDreamsAreMadeOf # IsThisMyLife

My first yoga experience 💗(1:40)
The benefits of yoga  🩺 (2:41)

https://www.youtube.com/user/yogawithadriene

___________________

I'm Tay, a married mom of 2 who was diagnosed with Autism at 31 years old. This was after YEARS of therapy (and all of the self tests in the world!). My diagnosis has brought up questions, frustration, doubt, but most importantly, a new level of self compassion and understanding.

I'm here to share knowledge, resources, and products that empower other neurodivergents (and their loved ones) to live freely and creatively. I'm not a doctor so please speak with your healthcare providers before implementing any recommendations I make on my channel. 

It's good for my brain to spend less time on social media, so you won't find me on Facebook or Instagram. But I'd love to chat with you in the comments! Or you can find my email address in the "Details" section of my About page. 
https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC0rQDkXDNeidKnUafldmpdA/about

Females are under-diagnosed due to lack of research. Please share any videos that are helpful to you so we can spread awareness and acceptance.

Theme Music by Milky Wayvers ("Mountain")
https://soundcloud.com/freetousemusic/milky-wayvers-mountain

title: Autistic Burnout, People-pleasing, and Misunderstood Empathy
description:
You may have heard that people on the spectrum have less empathy than others. This is simply not true! In many ways I feel we have MORE. But what can we do when showing empathy requires more energy than we can give? 

In this video, I'm discussing 5 strategies to help prevent burnout from caring for others. (Scroll down for timestamps to jump to a specific section of the video.)

💻 ONLINE COURSE How to Unmask: Cultivating Your True Autistic Self: https://taylorheaton.podia.com/how-to-unmask-finding-your-true-self-as-an-autistic-adult

🌟 ⏩ Connect with others like you in an Autistic Community Group: https://taylorheaton.as.me/schedule.php

👉 ✴️ 1-on-1 Session with Taylor: https://taylorheaton.as.me/?appointmentType=42852597

❤️ 🧡 💛 MY FAVORITE THINGS 💚 💙 💜

ONO Fidget Roller (affiliate link): http://bit.ly/3xLZnQY (use code: MOMONTHESPECTRUM for 10% off at checkout)

Flare Earbuds for Sensory Overwhelm (affiliate link): https://www.flareaudio.com/momonthespectrum

Manta Weighted Sleep Mask (affiliate link): http://bit.ly/3n3l64I (use code: MOMONTHESPECTRUM for 10% off at checkout)

📪 Business Mailing Address 📬
Taylor Heaton
8901 Tehama Ridge Parkway, Suite 127
PMB 680
Fort Worth, TX 76177

🌟 MORE RESOURCES: https://www.momonthespectrum.life

# WhatDreamsAreMadeOf # IsThisMyLife

VIDEO MARKERS:
What is empathy? (0:46)
Strategies to Prevent Burnout:
1: Take care of yourself first (3:48)
2: Accept that you need a lot of alone time (5:21)
3. Notice subtle mood shifts (5:58)
4. Use empathy as a tool (7:21)
5. Be aware that you might take on other people’s emotional work (8:37)
Resources (11:43)
_______________________

I'm Tay, a married mom of 2 who was diagnosed with Autism at 31 years old. This was after YEARS of therapy (and all of the self tests in the world!). My diagnosis has brought up questions, frustration, doubt, but most importantly, a new level of self compassion and understanding.

I'm here to share knowledge, resources, and products that empower other neurodivergents (and their loved ones) to live freely and creatively. I'm not a doctor so please speak with your healthcare providers before implementing any recommendations I make on my channel. 

It's good for my brain to spend less time on social media, so you won't find me on Facebook or Instagram. But I'd love to chat with you in the comments! Or you can find my email address in the "Details" section of my About page. 
https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC0rQDkXDNeidKnUafldmpdA/about

Females are under-diagnosed due to lack of research. Please share any videos that are helpful to you so we can spread awareness and acceptance.

RESOURCES
What is an empath?: 
https://www.healthline.com/health/what-is-an-empath#easily-overloaded

Autism and Empathy: https://embrace-autism.com/autism-and-empathy/

Who You Were Meant to Be: https://www.amazon.com/Who-You-Were-Meant-Rediscovering/dp/1693896699/ref=sr_1_2?dchild=1&keywords=who+you+were+meant+to+be&qid=1624911434&sr=8-2

Balancing Boundaries and Social Events: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gI7x982Nxb0&t=36s

Preventing Adult Autistic Meltdowns: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JFvNmBXcvCQ&t=433s



Music by Milky Wayvers ("Mountain")
https://soundcloud.com/freetousemusic/milky-wayvers-mountain

title: Balancing Self Care and Social Events | Adult Autism
description:
This week I'm answering a question direct from one of the comments: xoxoLeony writes: How do you balance respecting your boundaries while also still pushing your limits sometimes? 

This is my take on how to protect yourself from burnout while still trying new things and participating in social situations. Check out the timestamps below to jump to anything that speaks to you in particular.

title: AUTISTIC RELATIONSHIPS: 10 Tips for Neurotypical Partners in Neurodiverse Relationships 🤟❤️‍🔥
description:
Being in a neurodiverse relationship can be extra challenging! In this video, Tay (neurodiverse) and her husband Scott (neurotypical) share 10 Tips for Neurotypical Partners in Neurodiverse Relationships. Tay and Scott have been married for 11 years and are currently navigating the first year post Tay’s autism diagnosis at age 31. 

💻 ONLINE COURSE How to Unmask: Cultivating Your True Autistic Self: https://taylorheaton.podia.com/how-to-unmask-finding-your-true-self-as-an-autistic-adult

🌟 ⏩ Connect with others like you in an Autistic Community Group: https://taylorheaton.as.me/schedule.php

👉 ✴️ 1-on-1 Session with Taylor: https://taylorheaton.as.me/?appointmentType=42852597

❤️ 🧡 💛 MY FAVORITE THINGS 💚 💙 💜

ONO Fidget Roller (affiliate link): http://bit.ly/3xLZnQY (use code: MOMONTHESPECTRUM for 10% off at checkout)

Flare Earbuds for Sensory Overwhelm (affiliate link): https://www.flareaudio.com/momonthespectrum

Manta Weighted Sleep Mask (affiliate link): http://bit.ly/3n3l64I (use code: MOMONTHESPECTRUM for 10% off at checkout)

📪 Business Mailing Address 📬
Taylor Heaton
8901 Tehama Ridge Parkway, Suite 127
PMB 680
Fort Worth, TX 76177

- - - - - - - - - - - - - -

🌟 MORE RESOURCES: https://www.momonthespectrum.life

I realized post-production that the list we share can get a little tricky to understand for us neurodivergent folks. We tend to be more literal, black-and-white thinkers, so I’ve replicated the list below in, what I think is, an easier-to-follow format.

10 Tips for Neurotypical Partners in Neurodiverse Relationships
(ND = neurodiverse NT = neurotypical)

1. Don’t speak in abstract terms (2:04)
2. Don’t treat special interests/concerns as trivial (3:49)
3. Don’t expect NT-level social interactions (5:47)
4. Don’t take differences personally, especially when it comes to how ND partners show (or don’t show) affection (7:47)
5. Don’t try to change your partner (9:48)
6. Don’t be flaky (11:15)
7. Don’t ask questions when the ND partner is busy (13:09)
8. Don’t overlook the need for the ND partner to have lots of alone time (14:51)
9. Don’t assume the ND partner won’t mask around you (17:15)
10. Don’t treat your ND partner like a problem to solve (20:37)

# WhatDreamsAreMadeOf # IsThisMyLife

RESOURCES
The Asperkid’s (Secret) Book of Social Rules by Jennifer Cook O’Toole: https://www.amazon.com/Asperkids-Secret-Book-Social-Rules/dp/1849059152/ref=sr_1_2?dchild=1&keywords=asperkids+guide&qid=1624132108&sr=8-2

Aaron’s Thinking Putty: https://www.amazon.com/Crazy-Aarons-Thinking-Putty-Heat-Sensitive/dp/B01IYAF4PS/ref=sr_1_20?dchild=1&keywords=aaron%27s+thinking+putty&qid=1624132159&sr=8-20

The Other Half of Asperger* Syndrome by Maxine Aston: https://www.amazon.com/Asperger-Syndrome-Autism-Spectrum-Disorder/dp/1849054983/ref=sr_1_1?dchild=1&keywords=maxine+aston&qid=1624132187&sr=8-1

*The term “asperger” has a problematic history and is better replaced with the overarching term “autism.” For more information, check out my video on The Upsetting History of the Term “Aspergers”: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Cc0QebZOqio. 


I'm Tay, a married mom of 2 who was diagnosed with Autism at 31 years old. This was after YEARS of therapy (and all of the self tests in the world!). My diagnosis has brought up questions, frustration, doubt, but most importantly, a new level of self compassion and understanding.

I'm here to share knowledge, resources, and products that empower other neurodivergents (and their loved ones) to live freely and creatively. I'm not a doctor so please speak with your healthcare providers before implementing any recommendations I make on my channel. 

It's good for my brain to spend less time on social media, so you won't find me on Facebook or Instagram. But I'd love to chat with you in the comments! Or you can find my email address in the "Details" section of my About page. 
https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC0rQDkXDNeidKnUafldmpdA/about

Females are under-diagnosed due to lack of research. Please share any videos that are helpful to you so we can spread awareness and acceptance.

Music by Milky Wayvers ("Mountain")
https://soundcloud.com/freetousemusic/milky-wayvers-mountain

# WhatDreamsAreMadeOf # IsThisMyLife

I'm Tay, a married mom of 2 who was diagnosed with Autism at 31 years old. This was after YEARS of therapy (and all of the self tests in the world!). My diagnosis has brought up questions, frustration, doubt, but most importantly, a new level of self compassion and understanding.

I was self-employed for 10 years as a private flute lesson teacher. After my autism diagnosis, I started re-examining my life and all of the many things I had said "yes" to, including my job. In this video, I'll explore the top few warning signs that told me it was time to look for something new, and give you some encouragement if you feel stuck like I did. 

I'm here to share knowledge, resources, and products that empower other neurodivergents (and their loved ones) to live freely and creatively. I'm not a doctor so please speak with your healthcare providers before implementing any recommendations I make on my channel.

Females are under-diagnosed due to lack of research. Please share any videos that are helpful to you so we can spread awareness and acceptance.

Music by Milky Wayvers ("Mountain")
https://soundcloud.com/freetousemusic/milky-wayvers-mountain

Females are under-diagnosed due to lack of research. Please share any videos that are helpful to you so we can spread awareness and acceptance.

title: ADULT AUTISM SHUTDOWN ⚠️⛔️ Here's What It Looks Like As It's Happening ✋🙈
description:
This week I hit a big wall after going too hard for too long without rest and not listening to my sensory cues of overwhelm (noises becoming too loud, conversations adding extra anxiety, not wanting to be touched...). I decided to shoot a couple of minutes while I was approaching my "no talking" mode... I find shutdowns really interesting and I'm learning how to pick up on cues to try and prevent them before they result in total withdrawal.

If you have any tips for avoiding meltdowns/shutdowns, I'd love to hear about them in the comments! Also, if you'd click the red "SUBSCRIBE" button, that really helps me out. It's the best way to support me as I continue creating free content for you. Always open to suggestions for future topics!

# WhatDreamsAreMadeOf # IsThisMyLife

MORE ABOUT SHUTDOWNS:
From Embrace ASD:
https://embrace-autism.com/meltdowns-and-shutdowns/
(Text below is an excerpt from the above article)

Things that trigger a meltdown or shutdown can be external, like:

Too many demands placed on the autistic person.
Unexpected changes in plans or routines.
Sensory overload.
Social overload — Being exposed to too much social interaction (particularly relevant to shutdown).
But the overload can also stem from—or be exacerbated by—internal triggers:

Feeling shame or guilt.
Feeling inadequate.
Feeling like an injustice has been done to us.

The straw that breaks our back (final trigger) may not seem to make sense. It may seem small to an outsider, but to us, it is that one drop in the bucket that makes it completely overflow.
- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
I'm Tay, a married mom of 2 who was diagnosed with Autism at 31 years old. This was after YEARS of therapy (and all of the self tests in the world!). My diagnosis has brought up questions, frustration, doubt, but most importantly, a new level of self compassion and understanding.

I'm here to share knowledge, resources, and products that empower other neurodivergents (and their loved ones) to live freely and creatively. I'm not a doctor so please speak with your healthcare providers before implementing any recommendations I make on my channel. 

It's good for my brain to spend less time on social media, so you won't find me on Facebook or Instagram. But I'd love to chat with you in the comments! Or you can find my email address in the "Details" section of my About page. 
https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC0rQDkXDNeidKnUafldmpdA/about

Females are under-diagnosed due to lack of research. Please share any videos that are helpful to you so we can spread awareness and acceptance.

Music by Milky Wayvers ("Mountain")
https://soundcloud.com/freetousemusic/milky-wayvers-mountain

title: Sensory Regulation Workouts for Autistic Adults
description:
Wait, do people with autism need different types of workouts? Choosing the right form of exercise can improve your moods, sleep, metabolism, and overall health. And some forms of exercise fit better than others. Some forms of exercise might even help with... PROPRIOCEPTION and sensory regulation. Big words, right? But super important to understand if you're on the spectrum or have loved ones who are.

In this video we'll explore proprioception and how it affects autistic people, specifically. I'll also share forms of exercise that help regulate proprioceptive needs and, with practice, might even help you manage sensory overwhelm.

I love to study all things health, but I'm not a doctor, so please speak with your healthcare providers before implementing any recommendations I make on my channel. 

💻 ONLINE COURSE How to Unmask: Cultivating Your True Autistic Self: https://taylorheaton.podia.com/how-to-unmask-finding-your-true-self-as-an-autistic-adult

title: Autistic Meltdowns Vs. Shutdowns
description:
Autistic people often experience meltdowns and/or shutdowns where recovery becomes necessary and spending time away from others is needed.

In this video I'll discuss the differences between meltdowns and shutdowns and how setting boundaries can help decrease the frequency of both. I'll also share strategies for setting boundaries and my favorite resources for learning this skill.

# WhatDreamsAreMadeOf # IsThisMyLife

I'm Tay, a mom of two who was diagnosed with autism at the age of 31. The beginning of my journey was particularly lonely, so I started my channel to help others in similar places by sharing some of my favorite resources, products, and information. I'd love to hear any ideas you have for future videos in the comments!

I'm not sponsored, so any products or resources I recommend, I'm recommending because they really work! But I'm not a doctor, so please consult your health care providers before making any changes recommended on my channel.

Please subscribe to my channel so I can continue creating FREE content for you! I love doing it and subscribing is super simple and free. No annoying emails, you'll just see any new videos I upload show up on your Youtube homepage when you login. 

Resources

Boundaries by Cloud and Townsend
https://www.amazon.com/Boundaries-When-Take-Control-Your/dp/0310247454

Nedra Tawwab, Boundary Queen
https://www.nedratawwab.com

Hannah Gadsby Interview
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PaT__mzkHbA

Hannah Gadsby Quote
"Once I was diagnosed, I always thought I’d get to the starting line of normal and now I go, “oh, no I won’t” so I’ll just save a lot of energy and avoid that scramble."

Brene Brown Quote
https://brenebrown.com/blog/2018/10/15/clear-is-kind-unclear-is-unkind/

Music by Milky Wayvers
https://freetousemusic.fanlink.to/milky-wayvers-mountain

#autism​​​​​​ #autistic​​​ #asd #mentalhealthdx​​​ #diagnosis​​​ #autisticfemale

title: Late Diagnosed Adult Autism Frustrations
description:
Females on the autism spectrum are highly under-diagnosed. When females are diagnosed later in life, they might find that people they share the diagnosis with say things like "but you don't look autistic!"

What does someone with autism look like, anyway? Autism is a spectrum and presents differently for every person. In this video we'll explore the phrase "you don't look autistic" and how this feels to an autistic person, plus things you can replace this phrase with to be more supportive for the autistic people in your life.

title: Adult Autism Diagnostic Process (Step-by-Step) ✏️ Do 👉THIS 👈 Before You Go
description:
Seeking an autism diagnosis as an adult can be confusing and intimidating. In this video I'll walk you step-by-step through what the diagnostic process can look like including tests, sample questions, timelines, and the #1 best thing I can recommend you do pre-evaluation to ensure you get the diagnosis you're looking for.

💻 ONLINE COURSE How to Unmask: Cultivating Your True Autistic Self: https://taylorheaton.podia.com/how-to-unmask-finding-your-true-self-as-an-autistic-adult

🌟 ⏩ Connect with others like you in an Autistic Community Group: https://taylorheaton.as.me/schedule.php

🟩 Click the “bell” to be notified when I release new videos

I'm Tay, a mom of two who received an autism diagnosis at the age of 31. At the beginning of my journey it was hard to find others who were in a similar situation, so I started this channel to share resources, information and products that have been helpful along the way. I am not sponsored, so everything I share is something I find genuinely useful! 

I’m also not a doctor, so please talk with your provider before incorporating any suggestions I make in my videos. This video is based on my own personal experience and not to be taken as medical advice.

Help me continue creating free content by subscribing to my channel! It's free and you'll get updated any time I post a new video. And as females are highly under-diagnosed, please share with any others you feel could benefit from this information.

The diagnostic process can look different for everyone, but the main parts of my experience were:

Extensive History Background Forms (1:45)
Pre-Evaluation Questionnaires (3:03)
Pre-Evaluation Questionnaires for Relatives (6:17)
In-Person Interview (6:58)
In-Person Testing (8:52)
Self-Evaluation Write-Up (11:05) *THE MOST IMPORTANT PART*


TESTS/QUESTIONNAIRES FOR SELF

(*Even though you can take some of these tests online, it’s extremely important to have the results measured and evaluated by a professional.)

Adult Autism Quotient:  https://psychology-tools.com/test/autism-spectrum-quotient

Beck Anxiety Inventory: https://res.cloudinary.com/dpmykpsih/image/upload/great-plains-health-site-358/media/1087/anxiety.pdf
(Purchase here: https://www.pearsonassessments.com/store/usassessments/en/Store/Professional-Assessments/Personality-%26-Biopsychosocial/Beck-Anxiety-Inventory/p/100000251.html)

Beck’s Depression Inventory II: https://www.kdheks.gov/c-f/integration_toolkits/Beck_Depression_Inventory_II.pdf
(Purchase here: https://www.pearsonassessments.com/store/usassessments/en/Store/Professional-Assessments/Personality-%26-Biopsychosocial/Beck-Depression-Inventory-II/p/100000159.html)

Personality Assessment Inventory: (Purchase here https://www.parinc.com/Products/Pkey/287)

Social Responsiveness Scale II: (Purchase here: https://www.wpspublish.com/srs-2-social-responsiveness-scale-second-edition)


QUESTIONNAIRES FOR RELATIVE
Personality Assessment Screener: (Purchase here: https://www.parinc.com/products/pkey/313)

Social Responsiveness Scale II Relative: (Purchase here: https://www.wpspublish.com/srs-2-social-responsiveness-scale-second-edition)

RESOURCES
Laura Zdan, Not Neurotypical Podcast: https://www.laurazdan.com/podcast

Dr. Laura Sanders, Northern Colorado Assessment: https://nocoassessmentcenter.com/about-us/

Final quote from Rainer Maria Rilke, Letters to a Young Poet: https://www.amazon.com/Letters-Young-Rainer-Maria-Rilke/dp/0393310396

ADDITIONAL VIDEOS
How to Find a Therapist/Diagnosing Psychologist: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qybY2iFis3Q

Autism Diagnosis at 31: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dC4pd0EbQSY&t=45s

Should I Seek an Autism Diagnosis?: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=J9TTW83NYHI&t=30s

Music by Milky Wayvers
https://freetousemusic.fanlink.to/mil...
